dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gym is filled to the rafters with screaming students cheering on their basketball team. One particularly good looking player, who we’ll learn later is JOHN TUCKER, fak one way, spins in the other direction and dunks. The gym goes nuts. We push in on a girl, KATE (17), sitting in th stands. She’s high up and she’s there alone - she has a b in her hand which she reads during time outs. She’s prett but not made up too much, and she’s dressed comfortably, as not to draw too much attention to herself.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I was in seventh grade when I realized I was invisible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A teacher arranges a group of seventh grade girls in line height. Kate is towards the middle.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Not really invisible - although, how awesome would that have been? No, it’s just that I didn’t make an impression of any kind. If I disappeared, it wouldn't even cause a ripple. A teacher shifts a young Kate one space over, now exactly middle.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I wasn’t the tallest or the shortest, I wasn’t the smartest or the dumbest, I wasn’t the richest or the poorest... I was just what’s-her-name, you know, the brunette? Kate, I think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spelling bee is in progress, as a young Kate takes her at the podium. She’s one of seven people left.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG KATE
dialogues.text: A-N-O-N-I-M-O-U-S. Anonymous.

dialogues.speaker: MODERATOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, that’s wrong. Kate walks away.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It’s not that I didn’t try - I was a pretty good speller, and a pretty good singer, and a pretty good runner-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of girls run past the finish line.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And in fourth place, just out of the medals, Kate Spencer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The auditorium is decorated for a dance and is filled wit freshman boys and girls. Freshman Kate sits against the wall, trying to look like a great person to dance with.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Even in love... well, I usually ended up out of medal contention there, too. A good looking boy walks over and takes in Kate and the o wallflowers. He looks to Kate’s left - at a rather unfortunate looking girl. He shudders, looks at Kate. Not bad. He smiles, starts over, when a hot girl to Kate’s ri suddenly pops into view - she’d been picking a button off floor.

dialogues.speaker: HOT GIRL
dialogues.text: Found it! She and the boy lock eyes - the boy veers off from Kate a holds out his hand to the hot girl. They twirl off like F and Ginger. INT. GIRL’S LOCKER ROOM - DAY Kate stands at a locker by herself, getting dressed, as o groups of girls around her talk.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It didn’t help that my mom and I were always moving. You can put up with just about anything when you’ve got a bunch of great friends to help you through, but, well, let’s just say “openness to outsiders” isn’t really what teens are famous for. One of the girls near Kate turns to her friends.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL IN LOCKER ROOM
dialogues.text: I don’t have anything for my hair. Do you have a barrette or something? Kate surreptitiously pulls the elastic band out of her ha turns to the girl. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Hey, I’ve got one.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL IN LOCKER ROOM
dialogues.text: Do I know you?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Not really...

dialogues.speaker: GIRL IN LOCKER ROOM
dialogues.text: Pass. The girls head out. The locker room is empty now; Kate’s alone. She sighs, puts her hair back together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in the living room of a house on moving day - boxes furniture scattered everywhere. A sweaty Kate staggers through with a box.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There was one last thing working against me. There’s a knock at the door. She turns and drops the box when she sees who it is - it’s an older boy, a knockout. holds out a plate wrapped with aluminum foil.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: (too cool) Hey. I’m Justin, I live next door, and my mom sent me over with these brownies or something... Kate takes the plate while she tries to push her hair int some arrangement that’s not too disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (flustered) Hi. I’m Kate. I just moved in. Duh.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: So, Kate, you- Something catches Justin’s eye.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Holy... Kate turns to see what he’s looking at - a gorgeous woman her early thirties just walked into the room. She’s been working, too, but instead of sweating, she’s glistening l a Sports Illustrated swimsuit model on a beach in Fiji. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She’s dressed in shorts and a t-shirt that may have fit h in grade school.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That other thing working against me?

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is my Mom.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Lori. Hi. Justin takes the plate out of Kate’s hand and holds it ou Lori.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: I made these for you. (then) I can pick up heavy things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate sits at her desk, taking notes as she reads a textbo

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It’s not like she can help it. She’s just incredibly beautiful and skimpily dressed. Okay, maybe she can help that part. Kate looks up from her book.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you get this on page fifty-one? Andy? We see that Kate is studying with a boy, but he’s looking the window. Down by the pool, Kate’s mother is tanning fa down, with her top on the pool deck beside her.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Turn over turn over turn over turn over turn over turn over...

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It’s not like being beautiful has made her life any easier. I mean, she’s never had trouble landing great looking men, she’s just had trouble keeping them. In the last seventeen years, she’s been through four marriages and I don’t know how many boyfriends. That’s why we’re always moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quick series of shots of different great looking men staring into the camera. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Hi

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Kate

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: I'm

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: going

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: to

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: be

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: your

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: new

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: dad. Your mom and I are going to, uh, talk in the bedroom, so you be a good girl and watch TV. Actually, here’s twenty bucks. You mind running down to the store and getting me some smokes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're back at the game we started at, with Kate in the stands.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But enough about me. The real story here is John Tucker.

dialogues.speaker: ON COURT
dialogues.text: John, our star basketball player, has the ball again. He passes it - no, he’s kept in the palm of his hand, he dri and dumps off to a teammate who’s free under the basket f lay up. More cheers, high fives all around. John’s a stud tall, buff, best head of hair on campus.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s John Tucker. Captain of the basketball team, family’s loaded, always voted most likely to everything, lost his virginity at 14. To the french teacher. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CROWD
dialogues.text: A pretty woman in her twenties, wearing a French flag sweatshirt and waving a team flag, cheers John on.

dialogues.speaker: ON COURT
dialogues.text: John hassles the passer, then jogs backwards on defense.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He’s the guy this school revolves around. At least, he used to be until... You know what? I’m getting ahead of myself. It all started when my mom got divorced again, and we moved to this town to “start over.” I got a job as a waitress at what turned out to be John’s favorite restaurant. I wasn’t the best waitress ever, but I wasn’t the worst...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate comes out of the kitchen and crosses over to find Jo Tucker (in suit and tie) sitting at a table with CARRIE, editor of the school paper. Carrie’s a super-smart overachiever with roughly a thousand commitments taking u her time. She’s also (like everyone with John) very prett

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Are you ready...?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (to Carrie) I’m not sure... Are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Do you recommend anything?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Me? What do you recommend? You're the one who speaks Italian.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: I don't speak it, I know a little...

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: That you picked up travelling around Europe. You’re so lucky. I can only imagine walking around the same streets where all those artists and poets walked, looking at the same sights Shakespeare looked at when he wrote (gazing into Carrie’s eyes) “Her beauty makes this vault a feasting presence full of light...” (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (then) Maybe I don’t need to go to Europe after all. Carrie blushes, gives a flustered laugh. John turns to Ka

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I guess we need a minute. Thanks. Kate walks off - it’s clear she’s more than a little impressed by John’s display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a different night at Kate’s restaurant. Kate comes o of the kitchen loaded down with plates. She hears a snapping, glances towards the source, then does a double take. John Tucker (in a letterman’s jacket) is there with different girl, HEATHER, who couldn’t look more like a cheerleader because she is a cheerleader. She’s been popu and beautiful for so long that she’s grown to believe tha her superiority is the natural order of things. John keep snapping at Kate without looking, finally Kate gets the plates down and heads over to John’s table.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Hi. Would you-

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: We’re ready to order.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Uh, okay. (to Heather) What would you like?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I’ll order for her. Heather puts down her menu, gets a huge smile on her face

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I love that.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (all charm) I love taking care of you. (to Kate, all business) Two spinach salads, chicken piccata for her, filet for me, medium. And don’t rush us between courses. Got it?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah. Can I- But John’s done with her, and has turned back to Heather. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: That sweater is so hot on you. I bet it’s even hotter off you. Heather laughs; Kate walks away shaking her head - what happened to the John that was here the other night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yet another night. John Tucker (in slacker-wear) sits at table with BETH. She’s a hippie throwback, a young Drew Barrymore type. She and John are looking at their menus.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I’ve never been here, I hope they have good vegetarian... (off the menu) Oh my Goddess.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Veal. lLet’s go.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, I’m sure I can find something. ANGLE ON: Kate, standing over at a waitstation with anoth waitress. She’s gestures at John.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What's the deal with-

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: John Tucker. Total operator. Brings all his women here.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: How does he get away with dating so many women?

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: (bitter laugh) He says his father doesn’t want him dating during the basketball season so he “keeps his focus.” Total lie. It’s just another one of his scams so they have to keep the “relationship” secret.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Unbelievable. How’d you learn all this? The waitress starts to cry and runs back into the kitchen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate is in gym class with the other girls, including John three current girlfriends (Heather, Carrie and Beth). They’re picking teams for volleyball - about half the gir are still waiting to be picked, including Kate. Heather ( cheerleader) is one of the girls picking. She points at Kate.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Uh... I’11 take her.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (too eager) Kate. Hi. I didn’t catch your name? Heather looks at Kate like she’s nuts.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Okay, moving on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The game’s in progress. A point is scored, and while a gi runs after the ball to retrieve it, Carrie (the editor) i gossiping with the girl standing next to her.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: You weren’t at the party. Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: I’m not suppose to say, but... (quietly) John Tucker. Behind Carrie, Heather is getting ready to serve. She obviously heard this - her mouth drops wide open.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Get out! COACH WILLIAMS, the gym teacher, blows her whistle.

dialogues.speaker: COACH WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Less talking, more playing. Serve it. Heather tosses the ball in the air and serves it - right the back of Carrie’s head. Carrie is knocked on her face.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Sorry. It slipped. The girls around Carrie (including Kate) pick her up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: I’m okay, I’m okay. Let’s just play. Every gets back in position and Heather serves again - ri into the back of Carrie’s head, sending her down again. Carrie jumps up and runs over to Heather, as the other gi crowd around and the coach starts madly blowing her whist

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That wasn’t an accident! Beth (the hippie) gets between Carrie and Heather, who ig her as they keep arguing.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: You better stay away from him.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Violence isn’t going to solve anything.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: What’s it to you?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: No man is worth us fighting over.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Listen, I don’t know what he told you, but John Tucker is dating me. Now Beth’s mouth drops - she turns and slugs Heather in t jaw, dropping her to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (from the floor) What the hell is your problem?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: I’m dating John Tucker. Coach Williams has finally made it over.

dialogues.speaker: COACH WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Enough. She grabs Carrie, who grabs the coach’s clipboard and swi it at Beth. Beth moves, and Kate gets hit instead. It’s a all out melee now, with Kate accidentally caught in the middle. People are falling, arms are swinging, and finall Kate snaps:

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Stop it! This guy is cheating on all of you and instead of being mad at him, you’re beating the crap out of each other?! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ll.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Silence as the girls look at each other, digesting the wi of what Kate said. Finally, Beth turns to Heather:

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Who’s that?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Pam, maybe? INT. GIRL’S BATHROOM - DAY Kate is at the mirror, trying to cover up the bruise on h cheek from where she got hit. Carrie comes in.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Sorry about your face. Kate, right?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Yeah. It only hurts when I smile. Or talk. Or do this. She makes a face in the mirror, winces. Carrie laughs.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: What you said out there-

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Sorry, someone just sat on me and-

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, that was me. But the thing is, you were right.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I was?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Look what he’s doing to us girls. I don’t even know you, and I hit you in the head with a clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: That was you too, huh? Anyway, I’ve seen a million John Tuckers, they all lie to get what they want, and the girls always put up with it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: You’re totally right. I never understood it until now, but you’re right.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Well, it helps that those are the only guys my mom dates. Pretty soon, you figure out they're all the same.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Come on. I’ve got some planning to do, and then we've got to talk to Beth and Heather.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: We? You want me to come?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Sure, in case we start fighting again, I’ve got to have someone to hide behind.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What the heck. I think my head can absorb three or four more good shots before I have brain damage. Carrie heads out of the bathroom; Kate in tow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, Carrie, Beth and Heather sit at a table. Beth and Heather don’t look too happy to be there.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Be honest. What are you going to do about John?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I’m totally breaking up with him.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: No you're not.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Like you are.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: It’s up to him. If he dumps you two, I’1l take him back.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: We’re going to end up right back where we started. He’ll get back together with all of us, lie about it until he decides he’s done with us and then dump us for good. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Beth and Heather stare at Carrie, unconvinced. Kate clear her throat.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I bet I know what you’re thinking. “I’m different. I’m the one he’s going to stay with forever.” Beth and Heather look at each other, look down.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Why not? I am the head cheerleader.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: You say that like it makes you some kind of god and we’re all losers.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: No. I mean, a little, but no. I don’t think that.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Let’s stay focused here. Everyone he’s ever dated thinks they’re different. It’s what he does.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: So what are we supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Kate had an idea.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I was just saying it’s always the women who end up getting hurt...

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Exactly. Why is he getting off the hook? We could all date anyone, and for some reason we let him walk all over us.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: It’s because he’s hot.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Hot? He’s the most gorgeous man I’ve ever seen. He’s like a Greek god, sent to earth to remind us mortals what beauty is. Beth notices everyone staring at her. She snaps out of it (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But you’re right. That’s not enough.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: So why not teach him a lesson?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: How? Break up with him? He’1l have someone else in a second.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: No, bigger. We're going to make him undateable, make it so no one wants to go out with him anymore. Carrie pulls out a huge sheath of color-coded papers and folders, hands a thick stack to each girl.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I had some time to go over some possible approaches. I’11 bottom line it: he doesn’t know we’re on to him. We can use the fact that we’re his “girlfriends” to set him up, humiliate him, and make him look like a fool in front of the whole school.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: (smiles, imagining it) That wouldn’t suck.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: And we won’t just be taking care of him. We'll be sending a message to all the John Tuckers that we’re not going to put up with it anymore. They’re going to have to treat us with respect.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: They’re going to have to stop lying to us.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: And cheating on us.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Exactly! I’ve got a whole section on that starting on page three.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (paging through thick folder) When do you sleep?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: I take ten minute naps five times a day. I’m like Thomas Edison. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: (whispers to Beth) Who?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (whispers back) He was a President.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Come on, what do you say? A beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Let’s get him.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I’m in. But if I find out this is some kind of trick, I’m back with him so fast... Carrie pulls out a small leather notebook, writes in it. Yes, this has some significance later.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Wow, this is great. He doesn’t stand a chance against you guys.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: You’re not going to help us?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Me? Why me?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: It was your idea.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No, I just pointed out that you all should do something. He didn’t do anything to me.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Didn't he? He got all of us mad enough to beat the crap out of you in gym.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Besides, can you honestly say that you haven’t been screwed over by a John Tucker somehow, somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Come on, it'll be fun. What else are you doing? Heather has a good point. Kate shrugs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Let’s get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Different groups are using the track: the female track te (including Kate) is running sprints, and the cheerleaders led by Heather, are just finishing up practice as random people jog by on the track. One of them is John Tucker, w stops and waits for Heather to wander over and join him. glances around to make sure no one is within earshot.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Heard there was a thing in gym yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Some loser was saying she went out with you.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You're kidding. That’s such a lie.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Oh, I totally know. Don’t worry. I mean, you can’t date-

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (sadly) The basketball.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: But if you could, I know who it’d be.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You know it, babe. John looks around to makes sure no one’s watching, slaps Heather on the ass. ACROSS THE FIELD: Kate is standing at a drinking fountain watching.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Euch. There's a guy standing behind her at the fountain, SCOTT.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Is that for her or him?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: That’s not usually the noise girls make when they look at him. Usually it’s more of a “ohhhhh...”

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (laughs) Jerk isn’t really my type.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: I guess he is kind of a jerk, isn’t he?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I’m surprised to hear a guy say that. I thought he was your god.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Close. Older brother.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh no. Seriously? Scott holds out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Scott Tucker.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Kate. I’m so embarrassed-

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Don’t be. If anything, I’m embarrassed about being his brother. I think my mom was experimenting with drugs or living on a toxic waste dump when she had him. Kate laughs. They’re interrupted by a bell. SCOTT (CONT’D) Damn, I’ve got to run. Don’t worry, your secret’s safe with me, Kate. Scott winks and heads off. INT. KATE’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - DAY Heather and Carrie are sitting in Kate’s living room as K opens the door and lets Beth in. Carrie has a new Apple Powerbook plugged into Kate’s television - on the screen Keynote presentation, complete with an unflattering pictu of John and a list of bullet points next to him. Very sli

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Did you talk to him? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Heather

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Yeah, he just stopped by my house. He said I’m the only one for him, you guys are liars, meat is murder...

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, we all got the same story.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Your house? Did you hook up?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Oh my god. You did.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: No. A little. (then) We can’t let him get suspicious! I always fool around with him! It wasn’t for me, it was for us! I mean, I enjoyed it, but... It wasn’t for me! and Carrie exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Told you she couldn't keep it together.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Figures you two would gang up on me. Little Miss Popular and Little Miss Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Hey, don’t lump me with her.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: What’s that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Just that we’re very different.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Meaning you're better than me. Kate laughs. Everyone looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Don’t you see? This is exactly how he gets away with it. He knows you wouldn't be caught dead talking to each other, and that’s why he’s so safe cheating. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Kate’s right. I’m sorry. We've got to stick together, all right? The girls nod. There's

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, he’s back with all of us, he doesn’t know anything's up, let’s keep it that way until we get him.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Speaking of which, does anyone have any idea how we’re going to do this? a pause. Heather holds up one of Carrie’s folders.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean, I read Carrie’s term paper-

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: No you didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Okay, but come on, it’s like the phone book. I flipped through, and didn’t see anything, um...

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Concrete. Yeah. You’ve got some great ideas, but what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Well, I mean, I don’t know him like you all do, but I noticed something. He makes every woman he’s with feel special, he tells them exactly what they want to hear... what if we showed people that it’s just an act? Really show who he is, so no one ever trusts him again? I mean, when I saw him, I thought he was cute, but after I saw how he was with all of you... The girls take this in, nodding.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Excellent. Good. Throw those away. Carrie grabs all the folders.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s get to work. (ve: computer) Beth, you mind starting the presentation? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Beth goes to the computer, reaches for a key.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not that. Just press the- no, not that. Move the cursor to- You know what? I’11 work the computer. Carrie pushes Beth out of the way, cradles her computer.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: I’m glad we're getting to know each other. I'd always heard you were kind of a control freak.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Kate, you get sodas.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE/BETH/HEATHER
dialogues.text: Diet.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: And Heather, you...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Sit here and look good until you need me?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Are we a well oiled team or what? Kate goes into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate enters just as her mother comes in from outside, carrying a bag of groceries. Lori’s dressed in her usual young, hip, sexy way, looking more like a teen than a mom

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Hey, what’s up?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh, nothing, just- Laughter from the next room.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: You have friends over?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Yeah, a few girls stopped by. Lori hugs Kate. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: I knew you'd like it here. This is great. I can’t wait to meet them. Lori heads out of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Actually, we’re- Too late. Lori’s gone. Kate grabs sodas and follows. INT. KATE’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS Kate enters the room right behind Lori.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Beth, Carrie, Heather, this is my mom.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Lori. The girls all exchange looks - Lori doesn’t look like a m

dialogues.speaker: LORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So what are you all up to?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Destroying a man.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Who do I make my check out to? The girls laugh. Lori crosses over and sits on the floor with the girls.

dialogues.speaker: LORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, who is he and what did he do? Beth presses a key on her computer; John zooms back onto screen, along with ominous sound effect music and booing.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: This is John Tucker.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Cute. Let me guess, heartbreaker?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Big time.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: You’re lucky I got here. I’ve got some experience in this field. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Kate can’t take any more. She pastes on a smile, trying v hard not to let her true feelings out.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Mom, I really don’t know if we should be taking advice about men from you.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Why not? I’ve dated a hundred of them. I know all their tricks.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: And yet, you still keep going falling for them.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: What’s the matter? She’s an expert.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Okay, then. Kate shrugs, hands out the sodas, takes a seat. She’s not happy camper. Carrie takes her place at her computer - he talk is illustrated by an impressive presentation, comple with video, graphics, music, etc...

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: All right, Kate’s right. We need to show people the real John Tucker. And to do that, we need a public platform - something where the whole school is there. That much I’ve already got figured out. Ladies and... ladies, I give you: the school election.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: (unimpressed) The election?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: He’s not even running.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Yes, the election, and he will run. Beth, you’re going to convince him.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: How do I do that?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: How do girls get boys to do anything?  23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hall is empty. Suddenly, the door to the boys bathroo crashes open, and Beth and John stumble into the hallway, an embrace. They break; Beth tucks in her shirt, John wip the lipstick off his face. Beth pauses under a political poster - a slick one with a photo of a smiling guy runnin for school president.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: You know, I’m surprised you never ran for any kind of office.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: It’s just something you do to get into college, and I’ve got the basketball.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess you’re right. Still, it’s a big popularity contest, and there’s no way he’s more popular than you. Beth heads back towards her class, leaving John looking u the poster. He doesn’t look happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie sits at a computer in the middle of a chaotic pile photos, old issues, submissions... There’s one other stud working there - he looks up as John enters. Unseen to Carrie, John points at the door, and the student takes of

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Hey, Carrie. What do you think about me running for school president?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: I didn’t think you got into that.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I never did, and all of a sudden I realized I’m missing part of the high school experience.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: It’s a little late to be getting involved-

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I’ve got to win. You’ll help me. You're the smartest girl I know, you run the newspaper-

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: (pretending to soften) You want my help? Well... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I knew you’d do it. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: What? John acts surprised, like he didn’t mean to let that slip out. He clearly did.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I mean, I love you for helping. I can’t believe I said that.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: No, it’s okay... He holds her hand, gazes into her eyes, then:

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: So, you'll do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four girls are sitting together at a table. Heather takes a bite of her burger, grimaces.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Since when do we eat here?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Since we can’t be seen together. If he hears we're friends, he’1l know something's up. Come on, it’s not that bad. Carrie samples her food, shudders, gingerly returns the b to her napkin.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anyone have a napkin they’re not using so I can blot the grease off my tongue? Kate hands over a napkin. Carrie licks it. Beth begins doing surgery on her sandwich - the other girls’ watch as removes the meat patty from her burger, removes the chees replaces the tomato and lettuce, and squirts about a quar ketchup and mustard onto it. She takes a bite, notices th she’s being watched.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Being a vegetarian sucks. I want a personal thank you note from every stupid cow and chicken I haven’t eaten. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Okay, here’s where we are. I’ve already convinced John that we should show a video for his campaign speech.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: A video that, let me guess, you'll be editing?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Isn’t he going to want to see it before you show it?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: I’m going to make two. I make a real one to show him, where he talks about all the things that make him a good candidate - loyalty, honesty...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: And we make another one where we cut ina bunch of stuff about what a sleazebag he really is.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Gee, I hope there’s not some mix-up, and we end up showing the wrong video to the whole school. It would ruin him. They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: To get the footage we need, we’re going to need a lot of equipment - microphones, hidden cameras...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Beth, that’s you.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: I don’t know anything about electronics.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Yeah, but you're rich.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Hey, I don’t like labels. My parents may buy into the whole bourgeois lifestyle, but that doesn’t mean I have to. It’s their money, not mine.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: If we agree that you’re a poor repressed member of the underclass, can we use one of your fifty credit cards? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Sure. Beth digs through her purse, pulls out credit cards, hand one to each girl. BETH (CONT’D) AmEx Blue, Visa Platinum... (sentimental) Oh, my first Master Card. We’ve had some fun, haven’t we? She reluctantly hands it over.

dialogues.speaker: BETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Be careful with him. His little magnetic strip’s almost worn off. INT. HEATHER’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Heather’s bedroom is covered with bags from electronics stores and spy stores. Beth and Carrie are playing with monitors, binoculars, etc. Heather’s in just a bra, as Ka tries to attach a camera with fumbling hands.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: All right, almost there. Sorry, I’ve never done this.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Put a camera on someone, or groped a girl?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Well, neither. Kate gets the camera on.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There, how does that feel?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Well, the camera kind of pinches, but you've got soft hands. Beth turns on a monitor - we see a huge distorted close u Kate’s face as shot through the camera.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Whoa.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: How do I look? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Tres bad angle - straight up your nose. Take two steps back from Heather’s breasts. Kate does. BETH (CONT’D) Much better. The lighting still isn’t great. Try turning to the left.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Oh, we're not doing this to get glamor shots of Kate. Kate, speak into the cleavage. Carrie puts on a pair of headphones as Kate steps back up Heather.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Um, testing. One two. Testing.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Okay, it’s good. There’s kind of an echo, but it’s good.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: What do I want him to say?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Well, we want him to act like a sleazy horndog, so...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Just let him be himself?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: That’11 work. Carrie pulls out her notebook, starts writing.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Sorry, do you mind if I ask... what are you always writing in there?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Just my lists. You know, normal stuff, same aS everyone. (off their blank looks) I've got my “to do” list, which is subdivided into my “to do today,” “to do one time,” “to do weekly,” you know. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then there's my “goals” list, again, “high school,” “college,” and “life;” my “contingency” lists in case one of my goals or to do items doesn’t work out the way I expected, my “observations,” my “notions,” which yes, are very different, and of course a few ideas for the screenplay I plan to write during my summer in Belize. Or Toronto, depending on the political climate. Don’t you all do this?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No. No one does that. Martha Stewart would meet you and go “you know, she’s a little anal for my taste.”

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Well, it works for me.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: What happens if you lose the book?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: You’re not going to freak me out that easily. I have a duplicate at home, and I copy the changes in every night.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Yeah, but what about all the “contingencies” and “notions” you come up with during the day? They’d just be... gone forever? Carrie processes this. Her eyebrow twitches. The girls go in for the kill.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe you should carry a third book-

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Stored in a separate location from the main book, of course-

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Right, and then you should immediately copy everything that happens into both of those books. Carrie starts hyperventilating. The other girls laugh.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Come on, we're just messing with you.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think you’1l be okay with two books. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: (laughs) Sure, you’re right. Good one. Everyone returns to their food. As soon as they’re not looking at Carrie, concern crosses her face and she clutc her book tightly - she’s been thrown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Heather are sitting on a picnic table.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: You sure it’s safe out here?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: The only thing I’m afraid of is you breaking my heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, Beth and Carrie are parked in a car with the lights out; Kate’s in the back and the other two are up front. Carrie holds a camera to the window, recording John and Heather, as she listens to them through the headphones.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: He’s good.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You know, I was actually wondering about that. Is he good? You know. In bed.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Don’t ask me. They look at Beth.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: I’ve never... (what the hell) Yeah, he’s great. He’s really great. (then) Not that I have anything to compare him to. I mean, he’s my only, of course. (off their looks) Well, one of a few. Let’s just say I can count them on my fingers. And the toes of one foot. Hey, could we talk about one of you now?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (to Carrie) So you never- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Nope, never.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Of course she hasn’t. If she can’t put it on a college application, why bother? Carrie laughs, pushes Beth.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (to Carrie) Wait, so you haven’t with anyone?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (to Kate) Have you?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (lying) Me? Of course.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Well, I haven’t.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Can I change my answer?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: I thought everyone was sleeping with him. I’m such a slut. She hits the steering wheel in frustration- the horn beep The girls all dive down in their seats, out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: BETH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m such a dumb slut. The girls laugh, shush each other, laugh some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our four are gathered, going over one of Carrie’s large checklists.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: This is going better than I thought. We’re having no trouble getting video of him lying.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'll say. The tough thing would be getting him to tell the truth. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Wait a second, that’s not a bad idea. We should get some tape of him with his friends, being himself. You know, for contrast.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Maybe this is crazy, but what if one of us snuck in the locker room? I mean, it’s the one place that they know girls aren’t around.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: (immediately) I’1l do it! The other girls laugh at Carrie’s eagerness. She blushes.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m just saying, I think I’d do a good job. I am the journalist here, I’ve done undercover stuff before-

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: -I can’t wait to see a room full of wet naked man flesh. They laugh at Carrie again.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: I do want to go, and not why you think. I mean, this is an amazing opportunity to see what guys really want. What they really think. Come on, throughout history, no one’s understood them - I’m about to get a glimpse into the heart of the male psyche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The basketball team, including John, are gathered in fron the lockers. They’re in a circle, and watching one player he makes a huge farting noise by using his hand in his armpit. Everyone bursts out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: JOCK
dialogues.text: Dude, that was hilarious! Check this out. He makes his own arm fart. Everyone laughs again. This is high humor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie’s in a locker with a camera, recording all of this She rolls her eyes.  32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More arm farts, more laughter. It’s like the Algonquin Ro Table. One of the guys rattles a locker door.

dialogues.speaker: JOCK
dialogues.text: Stupid locker’s stuck again.

dialogues.speaker: JOCK
dialogues.text: Just use Greg’s - he’s out today. He gestures at the locker directly behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie’s eyes go wide - this is Greg’s locker. She looks around, but really, where are you going to hide in a lock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jock #2 gets to the locker and is just about to open it w

dialogues.speaker: JOCK
dialogues.text: Look ma, no hands! He makes the biggest farting noise of all - and has both hands straight up in the air. He laughs - all the other g make disgusted noises and move away, including the jock w was just about to reveal Carrie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie’s eyes are watering. She doesn’t look too happy, considering she was just “saved.” EXT. JOHN’S HOUSE - BACKYARD - NIGHT Beth and John are in his backyard, making out on a lounge chair next to the pool. He stands up, picking Beth up in arms. She laughs and screams, not protesting too much, as carries her over to the pool. He tosses her in - a second later she starts screaming in earnest, clutching her ches

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Ow! What the!? Jesus! She hops out of the pool and rips off her shirt, throwing camera hidden there onto the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John looks straight into the camera. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What the...

dialogues.speaker: BETH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Beeper! It’s my beeper!

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You keep your beeper in your bra? And when did you start wearing a bra, anyway? PULL BACK to reveal we're in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our four girls are watching the video on the computer monitor. Beth doesn’t look happy, the other three are try to contain their laughter.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: That’s not even the worst part. I don’t know if you’ve ever been shocked, but it makes you really- A huge THUMP comes from the monitor. The girls wince. BETH (CONT’D) Dizzy.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Do you think he bought the beeper story?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: I have no idea. When I came to, he’d left me on my front porch. I think he thought he’d killed me.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Always a gentleman.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Do we have enough stuff on tape?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: I’m not putting that back on.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: The bra or the camera?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Either.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: I think we’re good.  34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students are just getting to work. Kate is at her station starting to measure chemicals, when Scott walks up to her

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Kate, hey, you don’t have a lab partner, do you?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Well, you know, I came into the class late, and everyone was already paired up, so-

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: I’m not making fun of you, I’m asking if you need a partner. Mine got burned pretty bad in the last experiment, and he won’t be back for awhile.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Before I say “yes,” how exactly did he get burned?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Well, that’s open to interpretation. He says it was my fault, but I clearly said “Dear God! Run for your life!”

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Sounds like his fault.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Thank you. So what are we doing?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Let’s stay away from fire, what do you say? (hands him a vial) Why don’t you measure five milliliters into that beaker. Scott does it, sloppily and quickly. Kate looks, frowns.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’re not even close. scoTtT I’m not?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You've got to get down at eye level, and wait until the bottom of the meniscus is at the line. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Check you out. “Meniscus.” If I would have known how smart you were, I would have set my last partner on fire weeks ago.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Did I say “meniscus?” I meant wait until the curvy part is at the doodad. Scott laughs.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Much better. Okay, I’1l try. Scott pours again, but carelessly splashes some on his pa He starts to freak, urgently whispering to Kate: SCOTT (CONT’D) I spilled it! What do I do? What is it? What is it?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: It’s a sodium chloride suspension! Scott starts struggling with his belt, in a panic.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Sodium chloride? It’s starting to burn!

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Yeah, you know, saltwater! Scott keeps struggling, then realizes.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Saltwater.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You really need to crack a book. Scott buckles his belt, pushes Kate, who laughs. He laugh back. While they have been talking, an eager freshman gir has been working the class, handing out something to all students. She gets to Scott and Kate.

dialogues.speaker: FRESHMAN GIRL
dialogues.text: John Tucker for president! She moves off. Scott and Kate look down to find they’re b holding campaign buttons. Scott puts his on. Kate gives h a quizzical look. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: It’s ironic. And inevitable. (in a trance) Resistance is futile. Wear your button.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. He just might lose.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: There’s a first time for everything. Just not that. Kate shrugs - we’ll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A plain looking guy (NORMAN) stands at the podium, finish up his speech. Above him is a large screen - like a rock concert, a camera projects him on the screen so that ever gets a good view.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: .+-So I would “treasure” the opportunity to be your “Treasurer.” Thank you. Norman walks offstage to a smattering of applause as a teacher walks up to the podium.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: All right, that was Norman Trent, running unopposed for Treasurer. Now we’ll hear from John Tucker for President. The crowd goes nuts as John Tucker walks up to the podium He smiles his winning smile and waves, finally motioning everyone to quiet down.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I’m a man of action, not words. Who wants to listen to a long boring speech, anyway? (calls offstage) Seriously, Norman, it’s the same one every year. (back to crowd) Anyway, I put together a little video to show you why I should be your President. Roll it. The auditorium lights go down, and the video starts playi on the large screen above John’s head. MONTAGE: JOHN’S ELECTION VIDEO

dialogues.speaker: BASKETBALL COURT
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: John stands in uniform, holding a ball and looking sincer into the camera.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I’m John Tucker. Some of you know me as Tucker, or Tuck, or T-man or T-dog. I thought you'd like to know a little more about the man who’s going to be your next president. What qualities make a good president? Besides great hair, of course. Even on video, John knows his audience: he pauses for the laugh. Once it dies down:

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, first, I’d have to say, loyalty.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN WITH BETH
dialogues.text: Shot surveillance camera style from a distance, so we can who he’s talking to.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know you’re the only one for me, babe.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN WITH CARRIE
dialogues.text: Same style shot, different location.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The only one for me.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’re the only one for me.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN WITH GUYS
dialogues.text: John stands around with his friends in the locker room, obviously unaware that they’re being recorded.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I ought to make them wear nametags, so I can keep them straight. The guys laugh.

dialogues.speaker: JOCK
dialogues.text: Dude, you are funny. Not as funny as- He gives another arm fart. The guys laugh again.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO AUDITORIUM
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: John looks up at the video, obviously confused. He looks over to the control panel where the video is being run fr runs his finger across his neck, signalling to cut. Over at the control panel, we see the A/V guy running it reach for the stop button. A hand grabs his; it’s Carrie.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Push that button and you’re going to eat that tape deck.

dialogues.speaker: BASKETBALL COURT
dialogues.text: John continues his speech.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: After loyalty, I’d have to say honesty. If you can’t trust politicians, who can you trust?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shot from Beth’s bra-cam. In all theses POV shots, John’s different outfits, so we know he’s talking to different women.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Friday? Yeah, I’m cool Friday night. How about I pick you up at eleven. CARRIE’S POV

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Friday? Ooh, Friday’s not good. I’m... doing some volunteer work at the animal shelter. Poor little kitties.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We can do it late. Like eleven?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Yeah, see, that’s when I’m going. They've got plenty of people during the day, but they need someone at night, just to snuggle those little devils, and, you know, give them some milk from eyedroppers. He wipes away a fake tear. HEATHER’S POV (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Friday. Huh. Yeah, the thing is, I have a game Saturday, so I promised myself I’d do a thousand push-ups at home Friday night, and then go to bed early. You wouldn’t want me to... His gaze wanders down into her cleavage, right into the camera. He stares appreciatively.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t want you to what?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Oh, the hell with it. Friday’s cool. I’ve got to make a call.

dialogues.speaker: BASKETBALL COURT
dialogues.text: John wraps up the speech.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, loyalty, honesty, and great hair. He runs his hand through his hair.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Check, check and check. I hope you’ve learned a little about the real John Tucker. Vote for me - it’s a slam dunk. John runs and jumps, but blows the slam, falling on his a

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Damn it! All right, don’t use that one. I’1l go again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The video ends, and the lights come back up. The crowd, a John, are stunned.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL IN AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: Bastard! People boo and catcall. Our four girls, spread out around the auditorium, catch each other’s eyes and nod to each other. Mission accomplished.

dialogues.speaker: GIRLS IN AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: Jerk!/Get off the stage!/What a loser! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John looks into the audience, sees angry faces, sees peop laughing at him... his worst nightmare. Then he sees the three girls who betrayed him, all beaming.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: John swallows, his eyes darting wildly, looking like he actually might crack... then he takes a deep breath and s up to the mic. Showtime.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Could we get the camera on? John appears on the large screen above his head.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'd like to talk to the girls in the audience. (to camera operator) Closer on my face, if you wouldn’t mind. The camera zooms in. John gives that disarming smile that mortal can resist.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ladies. I have a problem, and I guess you all know about it now. I love too deeply. When I’m with a girl, when I look into her eyes, see who she really is... I fall in love. I can’t help it. I guess I’ma romantic. Our girls look around - the other girls in the audience a hypnotized by John’s big eyes staring into theirs.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know I look like a player, but the truth is, I meant every word I said to every one of those girls. The sad thing is, no matter how much I want it, I haven’t had that great love returned yet. I haven’t found that one girl who is the only girl for me. I haven’t found that one person who I can give myself completely to, who I can tell my secrets, who I can cry with, share my pain, hold, hug... Back in the audience, two female teachers are standing ne to each other. They’re as smitten as anyone. One leans ov and whispers to the other:

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE TEACHER
dialogues.text: Is he eighteen yet? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: So, as you can see, I keep looking. And I promise you, I will find her. Maybe it’s you. I don’t know. But if it is, I’m going to find you, and I’m going to give you my heart to do with as you will. Girls are now crying. Everyone in the entire place - exce our girls - is convinced that they’re the one. Heather le over to Beth.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: He just seduced the entire school.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: He just seduced half the school. And Bill. Angle on a boy who looks just as smitten as the girls.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess you’re right. That speech isn’t exactly going to work on the rest of the guys. On stage, John motions for the cameraman to pull back. On he does.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: And guys, I have one question for you. Who made the winning basket that gave us the state championship?! The boys all erupt.

dialogues.speaker: BOYS IN HALL
dialogues.text: You did! John Tucker! The girls join in, cheering.

dialogues.speaker: ALL
dialogues.text: John Tucker for president! John Tucker for God! John catches Carrie’s eye, looks straight at her.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (mouths to Carrie) Thank you. Carrie screams in frustration, pulls out her notebook, an scribbles madly.  42. INT. LORI’S BEDROOM - DAY Lori is working out. Kate comes in and collapses on the b as her mom finishes up.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: So, how’s the big day go? Did you rid the world of John Tucker once and for all?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Not even close. He’s stronger than ever.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: How'd that happen?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. He’s John Tucker. It doesn’t matter what he does, it’s how he looks doing it. I’m so depressed. Change the subject to something good, will you?

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: I met someone.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (groans ) I said something good.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Well, this might be good. He’s... well, he’s a little different from most of the guys I’ve met.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Different how?

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Don’t be scared. He’s a lawyer, and he’s running for Mayor. I’m volunteering on his campaign.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (sincerely impressed) Wow.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: I know - he’s not a drummer, and as far as I can tell, he’s not in rehab.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I love this guy! Lori smiles, keeps working out.  43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather arrives in her car, climbs out, notices that Carrie also just arrived. They lock eyes for a moment, but don’t talk. Beth is They turn and head for school when Kate runs up.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Hey, there you guys are. I tried to call everyone, but I guess I missed you. How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: How do you think? We blew it. We had one shot at him, and we blew it.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: He’s more popular than ever, and now none of us get him.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: So now what?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: It’s over. We stop hanging out together, we go back to our own little groups and watch John date his way through the rest of the cheerleaders.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: It was a compliment.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: It didn’t sound like one.

dialogues.speaker: BETH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Heather! Carrie! Kate! running across the parking lot. BETH (CONT’D) Good. We’re all here. I figured it out.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: What, that video thing doesn’t look like it’s going to work out after all?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: No, that we've been going about it wrong. I was home last night, crying and stuffing my face- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Tell me about it. I can’t eat again until June.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: And I thought, “I can’t believe it. I let this guy break my heart twice.” And that’s when it hit me. We’ve been trying to humiliate him, and maybe that’1l never work. But we never did the most obvious thing. We have to do to him what he does to girls. We have to break his heart.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: That’s great in theory, but how?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I don’t think he has a heart to break.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Come on, we know everything about him. We know his strengths and his weaknesses, we know how he operates, we know what he thinks... What if we used all of that to make him fall in love, really fall in love, and then break him? Maybe we can’t make it so that other women won’t want to date him, but we can make it so that he won’t want to date anyone else. The girls are taken in by her passion, but...

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: How? He knows we all went after him with the video. He’1ll never trust us again - he hates all of us.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Not all of us. Beth turns to Kate. Heather and Carrie also turn to Kate.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You want me to... No. No way.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: This is really smart.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: She’s a blank slate - we can make her into anything.
(CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Guys, hold on. It’s a great idea, but I’m not the person to do it.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I don't like him. I don’t like anyone like him. He’s a shallow, manipulative jerk.. Let me ask you - would any of you want to date him now, knowing everything you know? The girls think it over.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Probably not...

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Do you really think he’d go out with me? (off their looks) Definitely not.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: So why should I?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Look, you won’t really be dating him. You'll be pretending.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I’m not that good an actress. Sorry. The girls’ passion fades.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Yeah, you’re right. It probably wouldn't work.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: (to Beth) It was a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Whatever. All right. The girls all turn and walk away.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Hey, Carrie, could I catch a ride after school? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: (without looking back) I’ve got some errands to run.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Beth? Beth doesn't even bother answering. Kate stands very, ver alone, watching the three girls walk away. She sighs.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll do it. The girls stop, look back.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just tell me what to do. The girls excitedly regather.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Well, if there’s one thing John can’t resist, it’s-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather stands in a cheerleader outfit, awkwardly holding pompoms .

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: A cheerleader. I always thought it was pretty lame, but I’ve got to admit... I look hot. Kate is standing in front of all the other cheerleaders, Heather by her side.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: This is Kate. She’ll be taking Nancy’s spot. A girl sitting in the stands with her leg in a cast looks shocked.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: You've got that bum leg... Sorry. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: It’s just a sprain... The doctor said I'll be better in a week.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Maybe next year. Okay, pyramid. Nancy sits back down. All the girls start to form a pyram with well-rehearsed precision. Kate watches, impressed, a Heather motions to Kate.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All right, Kate, you’re on top.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I’'ll pass. I get dizzy in high heels.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Trust me, this is an honor. Molly’s been waiting for three years to get up there. Heather points to Molly, on the bottom, straining under t weight over her, a hand in her face.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: (forced smile) Someday. Heather boost Kate up.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What if I pass out and fall?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: That’s what the mats are for. Come on, you're almost there... Kate climbs up, looking a little unsteady, but finally ge to the top. She smiles - this is pretty cool.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See, you're fine.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess I am. Go gladiators! Kate’s beaming, on top of the world. She throws her arms in the air, and immediately falls off the top of the pyra Luckily, her landing is cushioned - by Molly’s head. Moll collapses.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry, Molly! Are you okay? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m- With Molly getting knocked down, the pyramid is unstable. Molly looks up just in time to see all the girls above he come crashing down on top of her. She’s buried. From the audience, the girl with her leg in a cast, Nancy speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: I think I’1l be better before Molly is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate’s at her locker, still in her cheerleader outfit. Bo pass, looking at her appreciatively; girls pass, looking her jealously. Heather nudges her, points down the hall: John is approaching with a couple of other guys. Heather walks up to meet him.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Heather. Hot as always. What do you say we forget about the whole “I tried to destroy you and failed thing” and give it another go?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Let me get back to you on that.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Come on. I may have strayed, but you know you’re the most beautiful girl I’ve ever- John’s radar goes off as sees Kate over Heather’s shoulde

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who’s the new cheerleader?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Kate. John looks her up and down with his expert eye.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Cute.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: We made her a cheerleader, didn’t we? But I wouldn’t bother. I hear she’s still dating someone from back home, some star football player or something.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You don’t say. All right, see ya. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John gives Kate one more look, then heads off. Kate joins Heather.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: That’s it?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Just planting the seed.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Did he say anything about me?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: “Cute.”

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Really? He said that? Did he say anything else? Should I go talk to him? (off Heather’s look) What? INT. GIRL’S BATHROOM - DAY The four girls are gathered.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Emergency meeting. I think we’re sending Kate in before she’s ready.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I’m totally ready.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: You’re not exactly playing hard to get.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh, come on. I don’t want anything to do with him. I’m not hard to get, I’m impossible to get.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Really. Tell them what John said about you.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What, about me being cute? Oh, come on. It was just a comment. I totally don’t care. If anything, it’s an insult. I know he’s just getting ready to use me. The other girls look at each other - they’re not so sure.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Kate, you know the John Tuckers of the world pretty well. 49. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I've been watching them operate at a million schools, and my mom’s dated a million and one of them.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Now, don’t take this the wrong way, but has one of them ever hit on you?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Not really, no. Wait - one of my mom’s boyfriends made a pass at me, but it never worked out, with him going to jail and all.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: John’s an artist. He’s the best at what he does. You just saw him seduce an auditorium full of girls - how do you think it’s going to be when he focuses all of that charm on you? This hits home. Kate’s eyes go wide - she starts to reali she might not be as ready as she thought she was.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: You can do this, but you have to be careful. Kate, John’s an athlete. He likes competition. He wants to win, not just have his victory handed to him. If you blush and pass out when he winks at you, he’s going to lose interest.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Exactly. So you’ve got to make him chase you. If it’s too easy, he’1ll move on. Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Absolutely. I really do. I’ve got it under control.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: He really called you cute?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s what Heather- (catching herself) Damn it. The girls laugh.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Look, it’s not that hard. Just don’t be eager. When he says something, count to three in your head before you answer. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t show any interest in him. Don’t even look at him too much. Don’t touch him, not even his hand. Got it? Kate doesn’t answer.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I said, do you have it?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I was counting to three.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Not that slowly. We don’t want him to think you’re deaf.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: All right, he’s noticed me, now how do we know he’1l take the bait?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: He will. I know John, I know cheerleaders, I know John and cheerleaders. Kate shrugs - they’ll see. Everyone heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're outside a classroom. The bell rings and the door opens; Heather and Kate come out to find John standing ri there, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: We just keep bumping into each other. I think it’s fate. Heather winks at Kate, walks off. Kate counts to three, then:

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: As the president of the school Welcome Wagon, it’s my official responsibility to invite you to dinner Friday night.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: That’s mighty welcoming, but I’m going to have to take a pass. John looks stunned. This doesn’t happen.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You busy, or... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Sure, I’m busy. Nice meeting you, John. Kate walks off. Once John can’t see her, she breaks out i a smile, obviously pleased with herself. A passing Beth whacks her with a book and glares at her - Kate curses herself silently and stops smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott's working at his station - flames suddenly shoot th feet out of his Bunsen burner. He grabs at the gas, turns off. Kate enters the room in her cheer uniform and crosse to join him. He looks up, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Huh.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Nothing, it’s just, you’re on the track team... I thought you were an athlete, not a cheerleader.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What, you don’t think cheering is athletic? I had to kick my leg in the air four times today. She does half a kick to illustrate. Scott laughs.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Nice, but I don’t think it really qualifies as a sport. If I can do it- He kicks his leg in the air, promptly knocking over a row beakers, smashing them.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (laughing) Impressive. We’re looking for a male cheerleader, if you’re interested. As Scott cleans up:

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: You know, I never see you out.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Out where? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: At parties, around... I know you’re new. If you're interested, I could let you know when something’s going on.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: That'd be great.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Actually, there’s a party this weekend. I could tell you where it is.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I'd love that.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Or I could, you know, pick you up.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Wait, are you asking me out?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: No, I’m just not good at directions. Giving them or following them. So I just thought it would be easier to pick you up. There's a commotion at the door - Kate looks to see a boy enter the room, carrying flowers. He goes up to the teach SCOTT (CONT’D) I mean, if you want me to ask you out, I suppose it could be that, too. I don’t want to compromise our great working relationship as lab partners, but- Kate didn’t hear, distracted by the scene at the door.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, what?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Oh, I was just saying- The teacher points at the door.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: No, you can’t interrupt my class. Where are you supposed to be?

dialogues.speaker: FRESHMAN BOY
dialogues.text: I’ve just got to drop these off. The freshman walks over to Kate, hands her the flowers, h out. Everyone is staring at Kate, who’s blushing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: Okay, if we could get back to... The door opens, another boy enters, with more flowers. He crosses to Kate, hands them over.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s your name? You can’t just come in here.

dialogues.speaker: FRESHMAN BOY
dialogues.text: Sorry. He runs out. The door opens a second later, another boy, more flowers. He crosses to Kate and drops them off. We follow this boy out into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least a dozen boys are lined up in the hall, all holdi bouquets. At the end of the line is a kid in a gorilla su also holding flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate is in the bathroom with her three friends. Despite herself, Kate’s a little excited.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Did you see all the flowers?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Classic Tucker.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: And the singing telegram? Not that I care, but no one’s ever done anything like that for me.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Wait until the picnic on his family’s boat.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Which I totally won’t be impressed by. (then) How big is it?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: You could land a helicopter on it.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
