dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s almost as big as his... (the other girls looks at her) Vacation house. What? I think about things other than sex. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: BETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (chuckling to herself) Although we did have some awesome sex in that vacation house. And the greenhouse. And the-

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Well, no matter how big anything of John’s is, I promise not to be impressed.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: That‘11 throw him. He won’t know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: This is actually working. We’re playing his game, and we’re going to win. (to Kate) You're going to be the girl who makes John Tucker fall in love. You’re going to be a legend. Kate looks at her friends, all looking to her with respec It’s her, EXT. the first time something like this has ever happened to and she likes it.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE SCHOOL
dialogues.text: Students are heading out of the building at the end of th day. Scott, John and some of his jock friends are hanging out by the door. John turns to Scott.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You know that new girl, Kate?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: She’s not your type.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Girl is my type. Well, except for the uggos.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Well, then, you’re definitely not hers. She listens to Elvis Costello, she reads Salinger for fun, not for class... she'd see through you in a second.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You're selling me short. I can pretend to be deep when I need to. Scott just shakes his head as Heather, Kate and a couple other cheerleaders exit the school. John raises his shade and nods to Kate. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, Kate, you get the flowers?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (without stopping) I didn’t know what to do with them, so I sent them over to the nursing home. My grandma and her friends flipped, thanks. Kate smiles and disappears towards the parking lot. John scowls - why isn’t this working?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Maybe if we headed down to the nursing home, you’d have a chance with her grandma. John chuckles, which the other guys take as their cue tha it’s okay to laugh along.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I’m glad she’s playing hard to get. The local girls have been so easy for so long, I'd almost forgotten how to do this. ANGLE ON: Two geeky freshman girls, taking in the scene. Then they turn and watch Kate as she walks away.

dialogues.speaker: FRESHMAN GIRL
dialogues.text: (awed) I can’t believe her. If John Tucker gave me flowers, I'd go out with him ina second.

dialogues.speaker: FRESHMAN GIRL
dialogues.text: If John Tucker gave me gum, I'd have his baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another basketball game -- we pan slowly across the crowd seeing all the same kids we saw in the opening scene. Everyone yells and applauds, and off screen, we hear the cheerleaders.

dialogues.speaker: CHEERLEADERS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Gla! Di! A! Tors! Gla! Di! ANGLE ON: Kate, in her cheer outfit.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: A-tors! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Widen to reveal all the cheerleaders, clapping and kickin The referee blows the whistle and both teams head from th sidelines back onto the floor. Kate edges over to Heather they can speak privately. Kate’s back is to the game.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t think our plan is working.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Relax.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I screwed it up. He hasn’t looked at me since I turned him down the other day.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Kate, I promise this will work.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: How do you know? Heather points over Kate’s shoulder. Kate turns to find J standing next to her, dribbling the ball.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Kate Spencer. How ya doin’? John’s near mid-court -- under the basket, the game is st going on. All four of his teammates are shouting for the ball, and the defenders are looking on, confused. Every other eye in the gym is on Kate.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Fine. How about you?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Not so good. I like this girl, but I don’t think she knows I exist. The gym is going nuts. The shot clock is winding down. 10... 9... 8...; John’s teammates are panicking, clapping their hands to get his attention; and his coach is turnin red, he’s so furious.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Excuse me. John turns, shoots from thirty five feet away, swishes it He turns back to Kate. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, what do you say? There’s a party over at Dan’s house, and I was thinking-

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Uh, John? The other team inbounds the ball and starts sprinting up court. John sticks out his arm and clotheslines the playe with the ball -- he hits the ground hard. The ref blows t whistle for a foul. The coach runs over to John, yelling whole way.

dialogues.speaker: COACH
dialogues.text: What are you doing?! Why’d you foul him?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: To ask Kate out. The coach takes a deep breath, tries to keep from strangl John. He glares at Kate.

dialogues.speaker: COACH
dialogues.text: Well? The entire gym is hanging on her answer.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (casual, to coach) If it’ll make him play, fine. Everyone erupts in applause. INT. KATE’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Kate’s sitting in a chair wearing a robe, as the other th girls all hover around her. Heather’s putting her hair in curlers, Beth is painting her toenails, and Carrie’s read from the school paper.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: What K.S. is taking the school by storm, capturing the attention of the school’s biggest prize, J.T.?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. (then) Wait, that was me? I’m the K.S. taking the school by storm?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: I couldn't write it if it weren’t true. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: So, do you think you’re ready for John?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (totally confident ) Sure thing. Play hard to get, count to three, got it.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Um, that’s when you were playing hard to get. He’s got you. You’re going out.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: So I... count to... four? Oh my god! I have no idea! I’m panicking! I’m going out tonight and I have no idea what to do!

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Should I slap her?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: You’re with three girls who know how he operates. You’re going to be fine. The trick is to just keep him off balance.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Yes, exactly. Once he figures you out, you're toast. So keep him guessing.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Lie, evade, ignore.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Or... just be mysterious.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: You got it?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (nods, then) No.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Let’s try this. I’m John, you be Kate.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Hey, I want to be John.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Look, it was my idea.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: So now we’re fighting about which one of us is John? This is stupid. I’11 be John. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The other two open their mouths to object; Beth just plun ahead. BETH (CONT’D) (as John) Hey, baby, how you doin’?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: (mutters) . Doesn’t sound anything like him.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Shh. (as John) I said, how you doin’?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh, I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: How are you?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Don’t be interested in him. Who cares about him? It’s all about you.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (as John) Wanna catch a movie?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I could.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Nah. Still too interested.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Maybe I should just grunt.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Not bad. Try it. Kate makes a noncommittal noise. The girls nod. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Nice.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (as John) What do you want to see?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I don’t know, you want to catch the new Brad Pitt movie? The girls shake their head.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: He’s not in control. You're in control.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: But don’t let him know what you really want.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: But it was good that you mentioned someone better looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Right. So better, but still lousy. Okay, try again.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (as John) So, what do you want to see? Kate thinks, trying to come up with the perfect answer. Finally, in a small voice:

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What do you think I want to see? And don’t be wrong. The girls clap. Not bad. Kate collapses back on the bed, relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John is driving Kate in his car.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: So tell me about you.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What do you want to know? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Everything. Who do you listen to, what’s your favorite TV show, what’s your favorite color... Who are you? What do you like?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You think I’m just going to spit it all out like that? You’re going to have to work to get to know me.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (laughs) You are impressive.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (too eager) Really? (catches herself, deadpan) Really. John reaches across Kate, opens his glove box, flips thro a stack of CDs. He takes his time choosing, finally findi the perfect one. He slips it in - it’s Elvis Costello's “Uncomplicated.” Not a hit that everyone would know, but so obscure that a fan wouldn’t love it. He starts singing along. Surprisingly, he’s a great singer, and he’s obviou been practicing this song. Kate is surprised, after a few lines, she interrupts him.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You like Elvis Costello?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: If you tell me you don’t, I’m kicking you out of the car right now.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No, I love him. I mean, he’s all right. I guess. (then) You know, you’re actually a really good singer.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I’m all right.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I’m serious, you’ve got a great voice. Have you ever thought about going out for a musical or something? John laughs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s so funny?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: “Oklahoma - starring John Tucker!” Kate laughs.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Okay, so maybe the school’s not ready for that. Kate shakes her head and looks out the window so John can see her smile. He may be an asshole, but he’s a charming asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids are streaming in and out of a house mid-party - musi blasting, every light is on, beer bottles are littering t yard. John’s BMW pulls up, drives right onto the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate walks into the party on John’s arm. They move throug the crowd, everyone smiling and greeting Kate by name.

dialogues.speaker: PARTY GOERS
dialogues.text: Hey, Kate./Kate, how ya doing?/Looking good, Kate./Great dress, Kate./Kate, hi, it’s Becky. From trig?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (to Kate) Looks like I’m dating the most popular girl in school.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Lucky you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate stands next to another girl, waiting to go into the bathroom. Carrie walks up, gets in line. The bathroom empties; the girl in front of Kate goes in, leaving Kate and Carrie alone. They immediately talk in conspiratorial whispers without looking at each other, in case anyone is watching.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: You've totally got him. He can’t keep his eyes off you, he gets paranoid any time another guy even gets near you... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I think you're exaggerating a little. They stop talking as the two freshman girls walk up to Ka They giggle and push each other. Finally one of them talk

dialogues.speaker: FRESHMAN GIRL
dialogues.text: I heard you got busted smoking pot with Christina Aguilera, and that’s why you had to leave California.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: FRESHMAN GIRL
dialogues.text: Are you really a Kennedy?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (laughs) No, sorry. The bathroom empties, Kate goes in. Carrie whispers to th freshmen.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Totally a Kennedy. Changed her name so she could try to live in peace. The girls gasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate finishes the drink in her hand, looks around for somewhere to set it down. From behind her:

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Freshen that drink up for you, ma’am?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh, could you, it’s- She turns and sees it’s Scott.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, lab partner!

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Just when I say I never see you, here you are. I thought you didn’t get out.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I always got out, I guess I just wasn’t getting out to the places that you were, so now we’re both out... here... (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (realizing this makes no sense) Maybe I shouldn't have another drink.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: What are you drinking?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Diet Coke. He laughs.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Who are you here with?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You don’t know?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Should I? Is it someone famous?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No, of course not. That was stupid. It’s just, uh- John walks up, puts his arm around Kate. Scott raises an eyebrow at Kate. This is a surprise.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Hey, baby brother. Dad told me to make sure you got home by midnight.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Hey, big brother. Dad told me you're adopted. John laughs and walks away with Kate, who looks over her shoulder and smiles at Scott. Once she’s gone, Scott shak his head in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party’s breaking up - the music’s off, everyone is heading out. John and one of his buddies are heading for door, carrying another guy, who’s either drunk or dead. J calls out to Kate, who’s sitting with Heather.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Let me just dump Howie in the bushes, and we'll go.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Okay. Kate and Heather watch them lug their friend out, banging into every piece of furniture along the way. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Time for the ride home. I guess this is where he makes his move, huh?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Oh no. He’1l be a total gentleman on the first date.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Good, that makes it easier.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: It’s all part of his plan. (imitating John) “I’m totally attracted to you, but I don’t want to screw up what we have by...” (light bulb) I’ve got it.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Oh, this'll work. Are you a good kisser?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. How does anyone know?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Do guys tell you you’re a good kisser?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (thinks, then) Oh my god, I’m a bad kisser!

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Look, this isn’t hard. I’m going to teach you everything you need to know about kissing.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Right now?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: We don’t have a lot of time. Pay attention. Heather and Kate notice that a young freshman boy is stan there, listening to them. He’s in a trance.

dialogues.speaker: FRESHMAN AT PARTY
dialogues.text: Go ahead. Kiss her. Don’t let me get in your way. Kiss her right here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Heather rolls her eyes, puts her hand on his face, and pu him backwards. He crashes to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John pulls up in front of Kate’s house. He turns off the car, turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: This is going to sound like such a line, but I’ve got to say it. You were the most beautiful girl at that party tonight.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You’re sweet.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Normally I’d be all over you. But I’m not going to do that, because I don’t want to risk what we have by moving too fast. John takes her hand tenderly, kisses her on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let me walk you to the door. When John turns to open his door, Kate grabs his shirt an pulls him back, goes in to kiss him hard. She misjudges, ends up banging into him.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (rubbing her head) Ow!

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m fine. My vision’s a little blurry, but I’m fine. Okay, don’t move. She goes in, slower this time, and kisses him. He’s caugh off guard, lets her kiss him. She runs her hands through hair, really messing it up. John relaxes, starts getting into it, runs his hands up a down her back. Finally he starts to creep his hand around the front - two inches before he gets us an R rating, she pulls back, offended.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you think you’re doing? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (flustered) Sorry, it’s just, you-

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about it. I had a great night. She kisses him one more time, then opens her door and get out. He watches her go, his hair standing straight up fro Kate messing it up. He’s in a daze - what the hell just happened? Kate walks up to the house as John watches from the car. doesn’t look back as she enters her house. INT. KATE’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS Kate comes in the front door, closes it, smiles a satisfi smile. Her mom comes into the room.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Here she is, back from her big date. How'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: It’s not really a date, mom. I don’t like him.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Right. Lori has something to say, but isn’t sure she should. She starts, stops, starts again.

dialogues.speaker: LORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Listen, honey, I’m not sure this is a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Pretending you like a guy... I don’t want to see you get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I’m not going to get hurt. He is. (then) Look, I’m doing this for my friends. I’m popular, I’m having fun, they’re being great to me... This is important to them, so it’s important to me. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Well, look, my advice is to not do this. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (carefully) Mom, I don’t really need your advice.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: That’s what moms do.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No, moms give advice about things that they know about. Lori’s hurt. Kate sees she’s gone too far.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mom, what I meant to say was I love you, and there are a ton of things I’d come to you for advice about, just not this. You have to admit that you’ve had your share of troubles with guys like John Tucker, so you might not be too objective, all right?

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Fair enough. Okay. Lori hugs Kate. She pastes a smile on her face, but it’s clear she’s still wounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bell rings; classes empty into the hall. Kate walks o of a room as John walks up, puts his arm around Kate.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: So, I’m thinking that I’1l swing by your house around eight.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Ooh, I’d love to go out, but I have plans.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Just stuff. John’s a little put-off - has he lost it?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Well, if you finish your stuff, give me a call.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I’1l put you on my list. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Kate kisses John on the cheek, and walks over to her lock John watches her go, then laughs confidently, just in cas anyone’s watching. Beth is standing at a locker near Kate once John walks out of earshot, they talk.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: You are getting so good at this. I’m going to do this to the next guy I date.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No you’re not, you big slut.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (laughs) You're right. INT. KATE’S BEDROOM - NIGHT All the lights are out in Kate’s room - the only illumina comes from a pair of flashlights that Kate and Carrie are holding. The girls are on Kate’s bed, playing Monopoly.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I never realized being popular could be so boring.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: It could be worse, you could be driving around the block all night staring at a dark window. She looks at her watch.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Time! Kate and Carrie turn off their flashlights and crawl over the window. The shade is down; they pull it up a few inch and peek out. Down on the street, John’s car slowly drives by. John’s f is visible in the window, staring up at Kate’s house. The girls back away from the window. Carrie pulls out her notebook, turns on her flashlight and starts writing.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Like clockwork. Carrie looks at her watch again.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let me comb my hair and brush my teeth, and we'll get some sleep. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Please tell me that’s not on your schedule. Carrie looks embarrassed, closes her notebook. It clearly on her schedule.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Of course not. I’m not crazy. Carrie tucks the notebook safely under a pillow, starts o of the room, comes back, takes the notebook with her and leaves. Kate laughs.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: INT. KATE’S BEDROOM - LATER THAT NIGHT Kate and Carrie are asleep and the lights are out. There’ beeping - Carrie sits upright, presses a button on her wa turning off the alarm. She reaches over and turns on the light, lies back down.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You think he’s still watching? The phone rings. Kate reaches for it, Carrie catches her.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Remember, four rings. Kate nods, counts, picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: WITH
dialogues.text: INT. JOHN’S CAR - CONTINUOUS John’s in his car, talking on a cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, Kate?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: It’s me. (then) John.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh, hey. I just got in. What’s up? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I was just about to leave this party, and I thought “You know what? I haven’t seen Kate all night. I wonder how she’s doing.”

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I’m doing fine. How about you? You have a good night?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Sure, did you?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Busy, but good. John waits, but there’s no more information forthcoming.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Well, as long as I have you, did you figure out if you’re doing anything Saturday?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oooh... I think I’m booked.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: That’s cool.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Listen, it’s not a date, if you’re worried- Now that he knows it’s not a date, John relaxes greatly.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Hey, until I put a ring on your finger, I can’t tell you what to do.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You think once a man gets married, he can tell his wife what to do?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: No, I was just saying, uh... So, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I’m actually going to be helping my mom out on that campaign I was telling you about. You can stop by, if you want.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: No no, you do your thing. I don’t want to crowd you. If you change your mind, give me acall. If not, I’1l catch you Monday. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Sure thing. (then) Oh, crap.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What’s the matter?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh, nothing. My mom’s been saying there’s some perv checking out our house all night, and I think I see him.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (trying to play it cool) Want me to cruise by and check it out? Kate looks out her window.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Nah, I’1l just call the cops. KATE’S POV John’s car speeds away. INT. JOHN’S CAR - CONTINUOUS John takes a corner, phone clutched against his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: All right, then, I’1l- The phone flies away, crashes onto the floor. He reaches down to get it, the car swerving crazily. He hits a mailb before he manages to get the phone and the car under cont

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, talk to you later. John hangs up, drives off, looking back nervously. INT. KATE’S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS Kate hangs up. She and Carrie burst out laughing. INT. SCOTT’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Scott's asleep in his room. John throws the door open, tu on the light and stomps over to Scott’s bed.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You up? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Scott doesn’t move, so John shakes him. Scott blinks out a dead sleep, very confused.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Hey, can’t a guy talk to his brother?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Not if the guy’s you, and not now. John sits down, picks up a guitar, starts noodling on it he and Scott talk. SCOTT (CONT’D) Fine. How’s life, John?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Great, as always. How about you?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Trouble sleeping, aside from that, okay.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Cool. Hey, what are you doing tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Please tell me you don’t want to go fishing and bond or something. Wait a second - do you have some incurable disease?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Dude, you’re so suspicious. (then) Hey, if you're not doing anything tomorrow, you mind doing me a favor? scoTtT I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Don’t you want to know what it is? scoTtT No, I want you to go away.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I want you to help me with a girl.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: If I were going to help you with anything, it wouldn’t be seducing some poor girl. Whoever she is, she’s better off without you. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Whatever. I hope you never need a favor from me.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: I won't. John puts down the guitar and starts to leave. Scott suddenly sits up. SCOTT (CONT’D) Wait a second, Kate Spencer?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Yeah, why?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I want you to go to some political thing that she’s supposed to be at, make sure she’s there, keep an eye on her.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Fine, I’11 do it.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Okay... Why?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: What is this, twenty questions? Do you want my help or not?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. I owe you one. John leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nerve center of the campaign is basically a sparsely furnished office space with “Valetta for Mayor” banners a posters with the candidate’s grinning face. Volunteers wo the phones and stuff envelopes. Kate is here - she’s licking, folding and stamping with the best of them. Her comes up with the candidate himself.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Kate, I’d like you to meet Sal Valetta.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: It’s a pleasure to meet- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Kate looks up, smiling, then blinks in disbelief. KATE’S POV Behind Sal’s shoulder is one of his posters. Kate stares it, then the real thing comes into focus - a perfect matc except that in real life his ears stick out so far, they like they’re coming after you. It’s truly disturbing - Ka looks back and forth between the photo and the man.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Sal turns around, sees the photo and chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: SAL
dialogues.text: I know. I still can’t get used to having big Sals staring at me, either.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (carefully choosing her words) It’s a very good picture.

dialogues.speaker: SAL
dialogues.text: Just between us? Good lighting and a lot of makeup. Kate laughs politely. Someone taps Sal on the shoulder; h turns away from Kate to talk to them.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: So, what do you think?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: He seems great, mom, really...

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Handsome?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No, not that. Lori laughs.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But that’s good. It’s different.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Very. Hey, that guy over there is waving at you. Lori points - Kate turns and sees Scott.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Scott? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: It’s John’s brother. Scott! Scott crosses over.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Hey, Kate.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: I’m here to volunteer. Lori clears her throat.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Sorry. Scott, this is my mom.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you. Scott politely shakes her hand, turns back to Kate.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So where’s the candidate? Kate points - Scott sees Sal.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Holy crap! (quickly recovering) I’ve never seen a real candidate before! Kate grabs Scott’s hand and pulls him away. They move as fast as they can, trying not to look at each other, becau every time they do, they laugh. Finally, when they’re a s distance away:

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: So, what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? I’m always volunteering for political campaigns. (off her look) All right, John sent me. It’s his way of keeping an eye on you without making it look like he’s keeping an eye on you. I’m supposed to play it cool, make sure you're actually here, not give anything away. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You’re like the worst spy in the world.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Or am I the best spy in the world? Kate shakes her head, pulls Scott through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Scott sit across from each other at a table, lic envelopes. Scott nods at one of the posters.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: I hope this guy doesn’t make any speeches outside. You know, a gust of wind comes up and suddenly... Scott mimes Sal flying away as his ears catch the wind.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I saw him trip once - it took three minutes to hit the ground. Scott lowers his voice and points across the room.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: I’d be careful. He’s only forty feet away - I’m sure he can hear you.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Hear me? He can take my pulse. Across the room, Sal sees Kate and Scott looking over, sm and gives a big thumbs-up. They wave back.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my god, I think you were right. At least, Kate tries to say that, but all the glue from licking the envelopes messes up her speech, and what she really says is:

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my gob, I think you bere ribe.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: (laughing, teasing her) Excuse meeb?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I thing my tonbue is tuck. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: It’s almost like your tongue is stuck.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Stob it!

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Stob it ribe now? Kate’s laughing so hard she almost falls out of her chair After she calms down a bit: SCOTT (CONT’D) Listen, I’ve got to ask you something. Why are you going out with my brother? Kate stops laughing completely, takes a sip of a soda to clean off her tongue.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (trying to be casual) Why do you ask?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: The first time I saw you, you didn’t seem too impressed by him.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You know what they say about first impressions.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: That they’re always right?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Is that what they say? I’ve been using that saying wrong for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: You just seemed like the kind of girl who wouldn't go for him. (shrugs) I suppose I shouldn’t be surprised. Everyone dates my brother. (quickly) But I’m sure you’ll be the last. I’m sure you’re the one. Hey, these envelopes aren't going to lick themselves. Scott busies himself with an envelope. Kate joins him.  80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John’s BMW pulls up in front of the restaurant. As John g out of the car, a valet walks up to the passenger door, b John waves him off and opens the door himself, giving Kat his hand and helping her out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So, I finally let John take me to dinner. I’ve got to be honest - I know it’s an act, but John Tucker makes you feel like the only woman in the world. As John and Kate enter the restaurant, Kate discovers tha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...-They’re the only people there. One table is set - it’ the window overlooking a lake. Every other table is cover with candles, which provide the only light in the place. It’s breathtaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They’re seated at their table, as four waiters come out f the kitchen - two pick up their salad plates, then the ot two set down the next course, all perfectly synchronized.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He rented out the best restaurant in the city just for us. Complete with entertainment. Three men come out, dressed up like a barbershop quartet, except, well, there are three of them. They begin singing

dialogues.speaker: BARBERSHOP TRIO
dialogues.text: Kate, Kate, Kate... John slides in front of them on his knees, providing the missing voice.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Kate. They sing as Kate laughs.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: After that, we went for a little ride...  81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and John sit next to each other in a horse drawn carriage, blanket over them, sipping out of mugs.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Taxis are so gauche, don’t you think? I’m travelling everywhere in one of these from now on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Kate sit on the deck of John’s family yacht. Kat looks over the rail as the ship cruises along, the stars lighting their way.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: It’s so great you run track. Did you know that women who compete in sports are seventy five percent less likely to be the victim of abuse? Kate laughs.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Do you ever turn it off?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (extra suave) Turn what off, my dear?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Okay, I guess you don’t.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: No, seriously, what do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Seriously, do you ever take a break and just be John Tucker?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: This is John Tucker.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No, that’s John Tucker, trying to impress Kate Spencer by talking about how great women’s track is. What do you want to talk about? What do you really care about? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Well, I love basketball... Hey, speaking of that, there’s an away game coming up. We'll be out of town, maybe we can spend a little time together...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Quit changing the subject. What do you care about, besides basketball?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I don’t know. No one’s ever asked me that before. John thinks, laughs.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t even know if I love basketball. My dad taught me how to play when I was like three, and I’ve just done it. Huh. (then) Would you still like me if I didn’t play basketball?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) There’s a lot more to you than basketball.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Well, you’d say that, because you’re different than most girls. Most girls want to be with me because of what I am, not who I am. Everyone thinks it’s one sided - John Tucker only dates the hot chicks. But a lot of those girls only date the stud athlete, or the rich guy... (then, light bulb) You know, there is one thing I love besides basketball. It’s kind of stupid and embarrassing.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No, go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: We actually talked about it before... I wish I were brave enough step up on a stage and perform. I don’t think anything would make me happier than to look down, connect with my audience, and just... He stares into Kate’s eyes and begins singing:

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Voulez-vous coucher avec moi ce soir? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: John can’t help it - he’s back in seducer mode. Kate bust out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cheerleaders are standing on the sidelines of a diffe gym - they're the visiting team - as the game is going on Up in the stands, Carrie and Beth sit together, taking it A boy sitting in the stands gets up to ask Kate a questio and Kate leans close so she can hear him. On court, John notices, can’t look away, and trips and falls on his face

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: God, was he ever that infatuated with any of us?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Of course not. He was always in charge. It was always us falling over our feet. They take this in for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: How far do you think we can push him?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: I think it’s time to find out. Carrie pulls out her notebook, reviews the well-worn page with the plan on it.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (reading) “Make Kate Date Bait.” Done.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Do they have to rhyme?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: No, it’s just nice when they do. (reading) “Play hard to get...” “Make him chase...” “Don’t follow Beth’s lead and give it up on the first date...”

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: It does not say that.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Just seeing if you’re listening. Okay, time to “see how far he’s willing to go for love.” (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: You only make a fool of yourself if you're in love.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: So let’s find out. And if it turns out he’s ready, then we can go ahead and... She holds out her notebook to Beth.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (reading) “Make John’s heart smart.” (then) Not your best work.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: I was stretching. Beth notices something.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Hey, it does say that about me giving it up! Carrie slams her book shut.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Come on, focus. Carrie stands and walks out, Beth following, looking peev INT. KATE AND HEATHER’S HOTEL ROOM - NIGHT Heather and Kate are in their hotel room; there’s a quiet knock on the door. Heather goes over and opens it, lets B and Carrie in. They have shopping bags with them.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Hey, guys. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: We think he’s ready. Kate looks a little nervous.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You really think I can pull this off?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: You don’t have to. That’s what we’re for. She shoves a bag at Kate. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Put this on. We’1ll set up the camera. Checks her watch.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go go! Kate takes the bag into the bathroom. Carrie pulls out he laptop as Beth and Heather drag a desk over to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: INT. KATE AND HEATHER’S HOTEL ROOM - LATER Carrie knocks on the bathroom door.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Come on, we’re on a schedule. What’s the hold up?

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m almost ready... Carrie opens the door and peeks in.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Wow. Carrie holds open the door, and Kate comes out of the bathroom wearing a short, sexy robe.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: How do I look? Kate opens up her robe, showing off her lingerie. It’s bl and sexy, and Kate’s in great shape.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: I’m going on a diet.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: (checking Kate out) I think I might be gay.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Well, there’s your answer.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: You are really hot. I don’t mean this as an insult, but why are do always dress like a schlub and hide yourself? You should take some lessons from your mom. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'll pass on that. I think the less I take after my mom, the happier I’1l be.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Come on, if you’d work it a little more, you'd be beating guys off with a stick.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t want the kind of guy who just wants me to look like this.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: But that’s all of them.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No. Is it? (thinks about it) Oh my god.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Okay, no time for epiphanies. Let’s go. Kate pulls her robe back on as Carrie leads Kate to the b The laptop has been set up on the desk facing Kate, and there’s a webcam on top of the computer. Heather, Beth an Carrie take their positions across from Kate, behind the computer. Carrie reaches over and presses a button. INT. JOHN’S HOTEL ROOM - CONTINUOUS John is on a laptop, while the other player in the room watches TV. From John’s computer we hear:

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN TIMBERLAKE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on a loop) Better have you naked by the end of this song! Better have you naked by the end of this song! Better have you naked by the end of this song! John chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: TEAMMATE
dialogues.text: God, how many times can you watch Janet Jackson's boob pop out of her dress? There’s a CHIME from John’s computer: we see the screen, on it a window has popped up: “KATE S HAS REQUESTED A VID CHAT. DO YOU ACCEPT?” John hits “OK” and a window pops up with Kate. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Hello there.

dialogues.speaker: WITH
dialogues.text: INT. KATE AND HEATHER’S HOTEL ROOM - CONTINUOUS Kate looks into the camera. Just on the other side, the other three girls are actively coaching her during the en conversation - holding up notes, mouthing words, pantomim

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Whatcha doin’?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Homework, you know.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I bet. You alone? John snaps his fingers at his teammate, points to the bathroom. The roommate glares, heads in, closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I am now. How about you?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Who'd they put you with? Heather shakes her head violently.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Not Heather. The girls groan.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean, they wanted to put me with Heather, but she didn’t want to be with me, because, you know, I’m dating you.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: So you're there all by yourself?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I know, isn’t that sad? I’m so lovely. She’s looking at a sign that Carrie’s holding up. Carrie glares, scribbles on it, holds it back up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lonely. I’m so lonely.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Well, maybe you need some company.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: That’s just what I was thinking. 88. But there’s a problem - I just tried to go out in the hall, and coach Williams is totally watching. No way you could get here.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Damn it.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I mean, unless you went out on the ledge and came in through the window.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (laughs) Yeah, right.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s crazy. Too bad, I got all dressed up. Or down. Kate lets her robe slip off one shoulder, showing off one strap.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I could try the ledge.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Awesome. I’m five windows down. I already counted.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I’m on my way. The girls high five and pump their fists - Suddenly, Beth gets an idea - she holds up gesturing madly.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Hold on!

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What? Beth pantomimes shaving her face.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Did you shave? it’s working. her hand, (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. Beth gestures shaving her chest.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Your chest?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What? Of course not. Beth pantomimes swimming. Kate smiles, getting it.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: This is kind of crazy, but I have a thing for swimmers.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Swimmers? Beth and Heather get it now, fight to not laugh out loud.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: There’s something so sexy about a smooth body. You know, like a swimmer.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I don’t know...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: It’s nuts, but when a guy isn’t shaved, it’s like wrestling a bear. I just don’t like hair rubbing all over my bare skin. Kate lets the robe fall off, so she’s just wearing her br

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: So, like, shave my chest?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Everything. Legs, armpits, everything. Totally smooth.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Not my hair...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No, of course not. Heather waves her arms.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hold on. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Heather pantomimes cutting hair.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Um, yeah, your hair, too.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: No way. My hair is one of the best three things about me. Eyes, hair, ass. There was a poll in the school paper. Carrie scribbles on a piece of paper. Kate reads.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: If you love me, you'll do it. (then) I didn’t want you to, but when you said you wouldn’t... I know if I loved someone, there’s nothing I wouldn’t do for them. John hesitates. This is a biggie. Carrie yawns. Kate follows suit, gives a huge yawn for John’s benefit, then pulls her robe back on.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know what? Maybe you're right. I’11 just see you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: No! Wait! Give me five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Be careful on the ledge. Oh, and I’m going to turn the lights out, okay? I’ma little shy. Just get comfortable and climb in. Kate blows John a kiss. Carrie closes the computer. The girls burst out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is completely dark - the only light comes from outside. And then through the window we see John inching along the ledge. He’s in the shadows, but it’s clear he’s just wearing boxers, and nothing else. No hair on his hea or his body. He pushes open the window and climbs in. In the room, he spots the bed, sees the person sleeping i it. He climbs into bed. (Now that he’s in the room, it’s impossible to see anything but vague shapes.)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Oh, Kate. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gl.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Oh, Darryl.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Darryl? Who’s Darryl?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Who’s Kate?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You mean Coach? The light beside the bed flips on. John’s got a big surpr - he’s in bed with Coach Williams, the girls’ cheer coach She lets out a high pitched scream, John lets out a highe pitched one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are filing out of their rooms to see what all the commotion is about. Carrie and Beth aren’t there, but Heather and Kate are part of the growing crowd. Coach Williams comes out of her room, John in tow. He’s still wearing his boxers, and Coach Williams is using the a handle to pull him along. She’s got them hiked so far u that there isn’t much breathing space left inside them.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: No... Dear god... Hurts so much... Please... Not that... They mean so much to me... We get our first good look at John in the light: he is completely, utterly, blindingly hairless. The crowd in the hall have their mouths hanging open: wha the hell is going on? Finally, the people get over their shock enough to begin laughing. Heartily. A FLASH - Heather’s got a camera and just got a prime picture. John looks at the camera in a daze, then notices Kate. Kate looks sheepish.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Sorry. I guess it was six windows. Finally John’s coach comes into the hall.

dialogues.speaker: COACH
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on here?

dialogues.speaker: COACH WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Darryl, I think this Chihuahua belongs to you. I found it in my bed. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Please make her let go. Coach Williams lets go and pushes John towards his coach, grabs his arm and leads him away in shame. People are falling over themselves laughing and pointing as he goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John walks down the hall, shaved head on display. People point and whisper as he walks, a few girls giggle.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: John’s aura was punctured. Don’t get me wrong - he was still John Tucker, and he managed to put a good spin on it almost immediately. John meets up with a bunch of other guys from his basketb team - they now all have shaved heads. They high five, admire each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Late afternoon, Kate trains alone, sprinting around the t as fast as she can, really pushing.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But he was in love, he was getting desperate, he was almost ready for the big fall. All I had to do was deliver. And nothing was going to get in my way. Kate stops in her tracks.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Scott! Scott stands on the side of the track. He applauds.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: I think you won.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I’m the only one running.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: I know, how smart are you? Kate laughs. As she talks, she steps up and down in place keeping her muscles warm. Scott notices, starts stepping along with her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Okay, you can stop making fun of me any time. I’ve just got to keep moving so I don’t cramp up.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: (looks at his legs) Wow, I didn’t even notice I was doing it. It’s like, when you talk to a guy with an accent and you start doing the accent? (Indian accent) I am having much fun dancing with you. Please try the papadums.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Okay, we’re stopping. Kate stops, Scott follows suit.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: You sure you’re not going to cramp up? I mean, you were jogging at a pretty torrid pace.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You want to race? Come on, I just did five miles, I’1l still slaughter you.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: No way. I’m just a big talker. Absolutely nothing to back it up. Kate laughs, then grabs at one leg, staggers forward.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Ow, Ow, OW... She collapses into Scott’s arms. Scott picks her up, carr her over to a bench and sets her down.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: I guess you weren't kidding. I’m almost feeling guilty for making fun of you. He kneels down in front of her, works on the cramping cal massaging it.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: “Almost?” What would it take to make you feel guilty?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Oh, something big. Like a leg falling off. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Nice. Kate and Scott laugh. Scott looks up at Kate... Kate look down at Scott... his hands are on her leg... and all of a sudden, things are weird. There’s a definite vibe in the air. They both immediately get uncomfortable. Scott lets of her leg and stands up.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Feeling better?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Thanks. After a long pause:

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I should finish my workout before I-

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Yeah, absolutely. Okay, good running into you. Kate smiles, turns, sprints away. Scott watches her go. INT. GIRL’S BATHROOM - DAY Our four girls are gathered in the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: It smells in here. I’m getting tired of meeting in bathrooms.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: We’re almost done, then we don’t have to sneak around any more. I’ve figured it out - I’ve got the perfect place to finish him off.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Yeah, about that... maybe we’ve done enough.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I mean, we made the guy look like an idiot at the hotel...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: That? He’s bounced back from a lot worse than that.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, we haven’t done nearly enough. This is just part of the plan. We hook him, then we crush him. All we’ve done is hook him.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I know how much you love plans, I’m just not sure how much more we need to do. The girls stare at her. Not happily. Finally

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s just feeling kind of, I don’t know, weird. Carrie snaps.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: What kind of crap is this?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Are you falling for John? Is that it? You want him for yourself?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Look at what this guy does! You’re as obsessed with trying to destroy him as you were with dating him. You’re still letting him control you. Beth holds up her hand to calm the other two. She goes ov to Kate, puts her arm around her, playing good cop.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Look, I know it’s tough, but we’re almost done. Let’s just finish John off, then you’re done. You never have to think about him again.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I don’t know...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Jeez, Kate, I thought we were friends. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Heather

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: We are. Aren't we?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I thought so. But friends look out for each other. Friends don’t say they’1l do something and then... searches for the right words. Carrie supplies them.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Completely screw everyone over!

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Come on, Kate. If you’re not going to do it for your friends, then what about doing it to send a message to the John Tuckers of the world? If we don’t teach him a lesson, he’s just going to go start ruining other girls’ lives. You know it.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: All right, all right. Momentary lapse. I’m fine. What’s your idea?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Get ready, because this is great. (then) You know how the elections are next week? Well, Kate is going to be the one to announce the winners, and she’s going to break up with John right there in front of the whole school.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: What the hell?!

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: It’s perfect. Everyone’s there, cameras are rolling, he’s ready to be have the whole school choose him as their leader... and we destroy him.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: No no no-

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: What’s your problem? This is a great idea.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: It’s a horrible idea. Do you know who announces the election results?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: A cheerleader, which is why- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: The head cheerleader. She’s the designated spirit representative for the entire school. Now, I know you think that’s a big joke, but it’s not to me.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: So? We make Kate the head cheerleader.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Good, it’1l make it even more painful when he’s dumped by the head cheerleader. Heather loses it, screams:

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Hold on one freakin’ second! She finally has everyone’s undivided attention.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m head cheerleader. Not her.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Heather, come on-

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: No, no “Heather, come on.” This is a popularity contest, and I’m the most popular girl in school. Well, I’m sorry, but it’s true. The girls in my family have always been the head cheerleader since, I don’t know, the pilgrims.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Look, we’ve got a plan, and we’re going to follow it. We all have to make sacrifices.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Oh, really? (re: Beth) What did she sacrifice? Her parents’ money?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Hey, don’t attack me! It was Carrie’s stupid idea!

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: You said it was great!

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: (to Carrie) And you, what did you sacrifice? Why don’t you make Kate the editor of the newspaper? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: I would if I thought it would help.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: No you wouldn’t. If you gave up one of your precious activities, you’d never get into Hartford. Silence. Then:

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Do you mean “Harvard?” Heather screams in frustration, starts for Carrie. The ot girls grab her and hold her back. Heather takes a deep breath, relaxes; when the other girls let her go, she snatches Carrie’s notebook and goes over to the sink.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: You want to talk sacrifices? Fine. Heather turns on the water and starts moving the notebook towards it. HEATHER (CONT’D) I hope you haven’t had any good notions today. Carrie wails.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Heather, stop! Everyone made sacrifices. She turns to Beth for help.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (reaching) Sure. Um... Carrie, didn’t you say that you got a “B” on a trig test because you were putting so much work into this plan?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: A minus. Heather growls.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait wait wait. And Beth. She doesn’t get to hook up with John anymore.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: That was really great. No sale. Heather pushes the notebook towards the water. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Kate, say something.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Uh... okay... Listen, Heather, no one’s going to deny that you’ve made the biggest sacrifices. But come on, nothing could make me more popular than you. The only reason I’m popular at all is because you’ve taken me under your wing. Just hanging out with you makes everyone think I’m somebody.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Absolutely. You totally rule this school. Everyone knows it.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Carrie’s right. As much as I say I reject the paternalistic power structure of high school, the truth is I'd give my right arm to be head cheerleader.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: (softening) You wouldn’t be much of a cheerleader with one arm.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: The only reason I never tried out for cheer is that I was afraid I wouldn’t make it.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: It would help if you were a little taller. But you probably could have made it.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: Are we okay?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: We're okay. They all hug. Carrie snatches her notebook from Heather, cradles it in her arms like a baby. INT. KATE’S HOUSE - KITCHEN Kate’s in the kitchen, on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No, sorry, she’s still not here, but the second she gets home I’11l- (listens) Hold on, maybe I hear her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Lori walks in the room, sees Kate on the phone, starts shaking her head violently.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oops, nope, not her, but I’11l let her know. Good talking to you, Sal. Kate hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He’s called three times.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Why don’t you want to talk to him?

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: I will. Thanks. But Kate’s not letting Lori change the subject so easily.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You're avoiding him?

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: (sighs, then) Yeah, I don’t think we’re going to see each other anymore.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Figures.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I said, it figures. You finally date someone who seems decent, and you dump him as soon as you can.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Kate, who I date is none of your business.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Yeah, I am. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Do you know how screwed up that is? You really think dating all those guys, moving to all those places didn’t effect me?

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: I know it’s been hard making friends, with the moving-

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: It’s not just friends - can you imagine what it’s like growing up with this? All I’ve done is watch you date jerks who ruin our lives. I’ve started to think all guys are like that. I mean, could my dating life be more screwed up? The first serious relationship I’ve ever had is with a guy I don’t like who has no idea who I really am. Thanks. Thanks a lot. Good thing who you date is none of my business. Kate storms out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Scott are working next to each other.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Hey, did you see Cake has a new album out?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Cool, I’11 have to check it out.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I just got it. Want me to burn you a copy?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: No, I'll get it.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Everything's great. Everything okay with you?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. Things are just a little... Kate makes a “mixed-up” motion with her hands.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’ve been getting a little of- (makes same gesture) That too. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I think it started when-

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Hold that thought. You’ve got a visitor. Scott points to the door. John is there, waving. Perfect timing. Kate walks out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate joins John.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Listen, I was wondering if you want to get together tonight - we haven’t really seen each other since the trip.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Yeah, tonight’s not great. I’m just really busy these days - it’s cheer season, and I’ve got to keep my focus.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: But soon?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Absolutely. I/’11 call you.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Hey, I hear everyone saying you’re the new head cheerleader.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Yeah, crazy, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Not so crazy. You are dating John Tucker. He flashes his million dollar smile, but it’s looking a little less convincing than usual.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Okay, see you. Kate heads back into the class. John just stands, watchin her go... He doesn’t look good. He kind of looks like a desperate girl who’s being ignored by the guy she loves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate walks down the hall - it seems that everyone knows h talks to her, congratulates her... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The week leading up to the election seemed to last about a minute, it was so packed. I sure wasn’t invisible any more - I couldn't go anywhere without everyone knowing who I was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate is waiting on an elderly couple.

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY WOMAN
dialogues.text: So, Kate, what’s going on with you and John Tucker? INT. KATE’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Kate’s asleep in bed; something wakes her.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: John got more and more desperate every day. And night. She looks out her window to find John standing down there guitar in hand, warbling Dashboard Confessional’s “Scream Infidelities.” His usually impressive voice is cracking, interrupted by the tears running down his face. Kate clos the curtains, lies back down, puts a pillow over her face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate walks through the cafeteria with another cheerleader talking.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We didn’t want John to fall completely apart before we had a chance to destroy him publicly, so I did spend some time with him... Kate and the cheerleader sit down at a table, and we see John’s behind them, struggling with their books and trays loaded down with food. He sets everything down for them; when he’s done, Kate pats him on the arm to thank him, th turns back to her friend. John waves weakly and walks awa from the table. INT. KATE’S KITCHEN - DAY Kate is sitting across the table from her mother. They’re both reading as they eat, not making eye contact, not acknowledging each other’s presence. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So the plan was rolling along. At home? Not so much. My mom and I hadn’t talked since our fight. Well, that’s not precisely true - I asked her to pass me the potatoes once, and she asked me if I'd picked up toilet paper at the store. So, you know, the lines of communication were Open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate sits with the other three girls.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And before I knew it, it was the day of the election. The buzz around school - started by Carrie - is that something was going to happen. It was the first time politics were ever popular. We got together that morning to work on my speech. It was tough, but we found five synonyms for the word “womanizer” and seventeen for “dump.” At last, it was finally going to be over, we could get our lives back... I was thinking nothing could possibly go wrong now. They finish; they all get up and head out of the cafe. Ka is the last to leave - she goes over to the trash to thro away her cup, and turns towards the door when she’s surpr to find Scott standing there. Looking extremely confused. KATE (V.O.) (CONT’D) It never pays to think like that.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (busted) Scott. Hey. Good to see you.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Since when are you friends with those three?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Well, Heather’s a cheerleader with me, you know that. And... I just know the other two. From around.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: And since when are they even friends? I didn’t realize that little video they made about John had brought them so close together. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I didn’t know they didn’t get along... scoTtT No, they’ve always hated each other. And yet here they are, still together, with you. Pretty mindblowing. Pretty crazy coincidence that the three girls who tried to humiliate my brother are best friends with his girlfriend. What’s going on? Kate has no answer. SCOTT (CONT’D) God, I was so wrong about you. I thought you were different than everyone else, then you’re hanging with them, you end up falling for my brother-

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I didn’t! Scott waits for her to explain herself.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look, you said yourself that your brother was a jerk. I mean, you've watched him hurt all those girls, dating them, lying to them, dumping them... We just thought we'd give him a taste of his own medicine.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: So, it was just some game the three of you cooked up, making him fall for you, and then what? You’re going to dump him? Kate nods. SCOTT (CONT’D) At the assembly. Of course. (then) You want to hear something ironic? Do you know why he fell for you? Because you were the first person who was honest with him. The first person who treated him like a human being. This lands hard on Kate.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Are you going to tell him? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: No. (then) He probably does deserve it, in some way.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: That’s what I thought, that’s why I agreed to go along with this-

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: In some way he does deserve it, but in another way... Look, do you really think it’s all his fault? He is what he is. He doesn’t really go out of his way to hide it. So who’s to blame - him, or the girls who keep lining up to date him, even knowing everything they know about him? (then) And what’s his big sin, really? Lying to women to get them to fall in love with him? God, that’s horrible. I bet you can’t imagine what kind of person would do that, can you, Kate? Scott turns and exits, leaving a shattered Kate. INT. LORI’S BEDROOM - MINUTES LATER Lori sits in a chair, reading, when Kate knocks softly on door and sticks her head in.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Why aren’t you in school? Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I needed to talk to you. Kate sits on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know I told you I don’t need your advice about boys. Well, I need your advice about boys.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: You know I'll always try. I can’t promise I won’t suck, but I'll try.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Okay. Do you think I’m doing the right thing, you know, dumping John tonight? Tough question right off the bat. Lori searches for words (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know you didn’t think this was a good idea from the beginning, but it’s too late. I’m in, and I need to know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Okay. Well, John’s a real bastard, right?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe there’s more to him. Maybe there’s an actual person there.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: He did hurt all your friends.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Yeah, he did. And if I don’t go through with it, they won’t be my friends anymore.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: You don’t love him, do you?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No, I don’t love him. Kate shakes her head, trying to sort it out.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, I can ruin the life of a guy who’s never done anything to me, and keep the best friends I’ve ever made in my whole life, or, I can not dump him and lose my friends.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Okay, just give me a second.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Tough one, huh?

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: And the thing that kills me is, it’s all my fault.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Mom, it’s not your fault-

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: What you said the other day? You were right. How were you supposed to know how to act if I didn’t show you? How were you supposed to learn about men when I was always dating bums? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Well, you told me not to do this.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Yeah, one good idea after seventeen years of screwing you up. Kate, you’re beautiful, you’re smart, you’re fun - you deserve to be popular, you deserve to date whoever you want to. All you needed was a chance. I’m sorry for being selfish.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Thanks. (then) So what do I do?

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: (beat, then) You want to know something sad? The first thing that popped into my head is “let’s move to a new town and start over.” Kate laughs.

dialogues.speaker: LORI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I’m really trying, but I just don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. I’1l figure it out. This helped.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Did it?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Not really, but I can tell you’re hanging by a thread. Lori laughs.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know, you don’t always date bums.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: I’m afraid I have.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What about Sal?

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Well, he’s no John Tucker, I’1l1 grant you that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Maybe that’s a good thing.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: You've got to get to school. We don’t have enough time to fix me. They hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gym is draped with campaign paraphernalia, the stands packed with students. It’s go time. Around the audience, see Beth, Heather and Carrie, none of them standing toget and John, standing at the front with the other candidates One of them, Norman, turns to John.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Where’s Kate? She wasn’t in Biology.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: She'll be here.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I saw her this morning, and then she disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You saw her this morning? (starting to come unhinged) How'd she look? Mad? Do you think she’s coming? Have you heard anything? You don’t think she just won't show, do you? Finally, whispers run through the room and everyone turns looks at the door, as Kate comes into the room. She nods makes small talk with the people she passes as she moves the gym. The PRINCIPAL glances at his watch, steps to the micropho

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL
dialogues.text: Well, since our designated spirit representative has shown up, let’s get this started. He covers the mic, turns to a teacher standing next to hi PRINCIPAL (CONT’D) (whispering) Is she dumping him?

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: That’s what I hear. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Kate gets to the stage. The principal hands her an envelo

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Hi, everyone. Thanks. Before I announce the winners, I’d like to say something about one of the people up on this stage. I know this is unusual, but bear with me. As some of you know, I’m not completely objective about this election; I’ve been dating John Tucker for awhile now. I’ve learned alot, and I think it’s time I share it all with you. A murmur from the crowd: here it comes.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
