dialogues.text: Sometimes you think you know a person. Especially popular people - you think that smiling, friendly face they put on is the real person. Sometimes they even start to believe it about themselves. If everyone loves them, they couldn’t be so bad, could they? But I’m afraid that sometimes that person is rotten to the core, they’re a liar and a cheat and they've gotten their popularity by using people and then casting them aside. They hurt people that they’re supposed to care about, and that’s just unforgivable. There are no excuses for that kind of behavior, and anyone who does that should be punished. Heather, Carrie and Beth are practically gleeful: all the work is about to pay off. Carrie holds a camcorder up, to capture the moment.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As you’ve probably guessed, the person I’m talking about is me. Gasps and shock all around.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I used John. I did everything I could to get him to fall in love with me, because I knew that if he did, I'd be popular. And it worked. Here I am. But to do it, I was lying to all of you about who I really was, and I had to hurt John, who'd never done anything to me. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don't deserve to be standing up here, I don’t deserve all the attention I’ve been getting...

dialogues.speaker: MORE
dialogues.text: ( ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to John) And I don’t deserve you. I think that buried deep deep deep inside of you, there’s a really sensitive, wonderful guy that’s going to come out for the right girl. I’m not her. I hope you find her. (back to audience) Thanks again for everything. I know I’m giving up a lot by doing this, including some really great friends, but I didn’t really earn any of it. So, goodbye. She starts to walk off, pauses, goes back to the mic.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One more thing. Why do we all make fools of ourself chasing after the John Tuckers of the world, anyway? Why are we so busy defining ourselves by other people? I don’t have an answer, I just thought it was a good question. (then) Oh, and also, since I probably won't ever have everyone’s attention like this again... It wouldn’t kill you all to come out to a girls’ track meet once in awhile. And with that, Kate walks off the stage, leaving behind a stunned crowd. John looks at the crowd, looks at Kate disappearing, and runs after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John catches up with Kate.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Wait-

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: John, don’t. I’m really not the right person for you.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I kind of get that now.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Look, I’m sorry-

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Don’t be sorry. Actually, I just wanted to thank you.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Thank me? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Yeah. You could have destroyed me out there. All those things you were saying... they’re true about me, too. We’re alike in a lot of ways.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: That was kind of the twist. Tricky, huh?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I’m going to work on it.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I’m still not sure how you did what you did to me, but it made me think about a lot of things. Who I am. Why I do what I do. Who I hurt. I guess I’m feeling...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: ..-Compassion?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I don’t know, but I don’t like it. They laugh. John holds out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good luck, Kate.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Good luck. They shake hands; Kate goes in and kisses him on the chee She then turns and exits the building.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And then, as I was walking out of there, I realized that there was one person who noticed me before John did. One person who did seem to like me for who I was.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACKS
dialogues.text: Scott coming up to Kate at the water fountain and talking joking with her... Scott asking Kate to be his lab partner... Scot talking to Kate at the party... Scott and Kate at the campaign, laughing with each other. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Scott helping her with the cramp in her leg... KATE (V.O.) (CONT’D) And one person who amazingly didn’t forget I existed the second he met my mom. Scott meeting Lori at campaign headquarters, shaking her hand, and immediately looking right back to Kate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate exits the gym and walks out into the night.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But I figured my chances with him were slightly damaged by the fact that he hated me.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Kate!

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Luckily, I was wrong. Kate turns to find Scott running to her. When he catches her: scoTtT Does this mean you’re not dating my brother anymore?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Finally. And he moves in to kiss her. It’s going to be the most beautiful moment ever... and she stops him.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What do you think you’re doing?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Kissing you? Romantically? Although every second we talk about it, it’s becoming less romantic and more uncomfortable. You’re just looking at me. Time is passing. It’s getting really bad now.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: And just exactly long have you been attracted to me? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: I think I suspected it when I first saw you, and I was sure when you glued your tongue to your mouth...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: So why didn’t you say anything? You know, this is all kind of your fault. You should have asked me out the second you met me, not taken “no” for an answer, and saved me from this whole mess.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: I’m... sorry?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (smiles) So am I. And he kisses her. She returns the kiss and they embrace, not letting go. KATE (V.O.) (CONT’D) So what happened to everyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in the middle of a game - John’s standing on the sideline as his coach yells at him.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Even though it didn’t happen quite how we hoped, we still ended up teaching John Tucker a lesson and changing him forever. John finally snaps and yells back at his coach:

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What’s the matter with me? What’s the matter? I’11 tell you! I don’t want to play basketball! I hate basketball! I want to sing! I want to sing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John stands front and center, belting out a song to a pac house.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Oklahoma! Where the wind comes sweeping down the plains!  115.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A high school couple walks hand in hand towards a car. Th split up - the boy goes to the driver’s side, the girl to passenger side.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Amazingly, another John Tucker didn’t spring up to take his place. From that time on, the guys at our school treated the women like princesses. The girl makes no move to open her own door; glances over her boyfriend. He runs around the car, opens her door for her, waits for her to get in, and closes the door. KATE (V.O.) (CONT’D) After seeing what women could do to even the mighty John Tucker when we put our minds to it, they were scared to death of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate sits alone.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What about the other girls? Like I said, we were just together to take care of John Tucker, and once that was done, there was no reason to hang out. The other three join Kate at the table, setting down drin and muffins. KATE (V.O.) (CONT’D) No reason except that we were all pretty amazing people who taught each other that men come and go, but friends are forever. We stayed close until the end of high school, and we still meet once a year to celebrate the day we saved the world from John Tucker. The girls all clink their coffee cups together in a toast INT. KATE’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - DAY Lori walks to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Mom turned out to be more mature than she thought... with a little help from me, of course. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She opens the door to find Sal at the door, holding a hug bouquet of flowers. He’s got a new hairstyle - it’s long comes down over the ears. Lori and Sal embrace; we now se that Kate is watching from the top of the stairs. Sal giv her a thumbs-up; Kate points to his hair and flashes him okay sign.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He’s easily the ugliest new dad I ever had, but he’s easily the best. (then) Who's left? Oh, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate is running sprints while Scott times her. They’re th only people at the track.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Scott was the luckiest one of all - he got me. And what about me? How did I turn out? Kate finishes running, catching her breath with her hands her hips. She walks along, then looks straight up into camera.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’m the girl who made John Tucker fall in love. I’m a legend. Kate smiles. FADE OUT.
